69 // Whenever the format of one of these file types has changed such that
70 // an old save will not load, increment its version number.
71 /*
72 // GJ: I moved this to memcard.q, because the artists/designers sometimes
73 // do things that will require a version change.
74 
75 #define VERSION_OPTIONSANDPROS 10
76 #define VERSION_NETWORKSETTINGS 3
77 #define VERSION_CAS 4
78 #define VERSION_CAT 1
79 #define VERSION_PARK 2
80 #define VERSION_REPLAY 6
81 */
82 
83 // The max number of files that can appear in the file list.
84 // A max is specified both to ensure we don't run out of memory in the files menu, and
85 // also to limit the pause before the menu comes up because it has to open each file first
86 // to extract the summary info.
87 #define MAX_THPS4_FILES_ALLOWED 75
88 
89 // Limit the space that the summary info structure is allowed to take up when written to a buffer.
90 // This is because we want to be able to quickly read in the summary info from the start of the
91 // mem card file without having to read in the whole file. (Units are bytes)
92 #define MAX_SUMMARY_INFO_SIZE 100
93 
94 // Max chars allowed in the low level card filename.
95 #define MAX_CARD_FILE_NAME_CHARS 100

101 // This value gets added to the character 'a' in the last char of the
102 // low-level card filename to indicate what the type of the file is.
103 enum EMemCardFileType
104 {
105  MEMCARD_FILETYPE_CAREER,
106  MEMCARD_FILETYPE_CAS,
107  MEMCARD_FILETYPE_PARK,
108  MEMCARD_FILETYPE_REPLAY,
109  MEMCARD_FILETYPE_NETWORKSETTINGS,
110  MEMCARD_FILETYPE_CAT,
111  MEMCARD_FILETYPE_CREATEDGOALS,
112 };
113 
114 // The old OptionsAndPros save file now contains the custom skater too, and is divided into 4 parts.
115 // The LoadFromMemoryCard command provides the option of only applying certain parts to the game state.
116 // For example, when loading a custom skater, only the CUSTOM_SKATER part is applied, so the career
117 // remains unaffected.
118 enum EUnifiedSaveFileSubTypes
119 {
120  APPLY_GLOBAL_INFO=0,
121  APPLY_STORY=1,
122  APPLY_STORY_SKATER=2,
123  APPLY_CUSTOM_SKATER=3,
124 };
125 
126 #ifdef __PLAT_NGC__
127 // Icons plus banner.
128 #define NGC_MEMCARD_ICON_DATA_SIZE ( 64 + ( 32 * 32 * 7 ) + ( 256 * 2 ) + ( 96 * 32 ) + ( 256 * 2 ) )
129 #endif
130 
131 // The mem card file starts with one of these, followed by two CStruct's as written
132 // out using WriteToBuffer.
133 // The first CStruct is the summary info for the file and occupies no more than
134 // MAX_SUMMARY_INFO_SIZE bytes.
135 // The second CStruct holds all the save data.
136 struct SMcFileHeader
137 {
138  #ifdef __PLAT_NGC__
139  // On the GameCube the icon data is stored within the file rather than as a
140  // seperate file. So lets wack it into this structure.
141  uint8 mpIconData[NGC_MEMCARD_ICON_DATA_SIZE];
142  #endif
143 
144  #ifdef __PLAT_XBOX__
145  // I think it is a TRC requirement to use the XBox's special way of calculating
146  // a checksum. They probably have ways of telling whether we're using it or not.
147  XCALCSIG_SIGNATURE mSignature;
148  #else
149  uint32 mChecksum;
150  #endif // #ifdef __PLAT_XBOX__
151 
152  // This is so that the files menu can see if a file might be bad
153  // given only the summary info.
154  uint32 mSummaryInfoChecksum;
155  int mSummaryInfoSize;
156 
157  // This is the size of this header, the summary info structure, and
158  // the main structure, rounded up to the platforms block size.
159  // So for all file types except replays, this should match the total file size.
160  // In the case of replays, the replay data comes after that lot.
161  // mDataSize is needed to indicate the start of the replay data.
162  int mDataSize;
163 
164  int mVersion;
165 };

271 // When transferring data between the online vault and the mem card, this structure temporarily holds
272 // the data. The LoadFromMemoryCard and SaveToMemoryCard commands can be made to load to/from this structure
273 // instead, so that data can be transferred without loading it into the game.
274 static Script::CStruct *spVaultData=NULL;
275 static uint32 sVaultDataType=0;

277 // Steve's code calls this after downloading the binary data from the vault.
278 void SetVaultData(uint8 *p_data, uint32 type)
279 {
280  if (spVaultData)
281  {
282  delete spVaultData;
283  spVaultData=NULL;
284  }
285 
286  spVaultData=new Script::CStruct;
287  Script::ReadFromBuffer(spVaultData,p_data);
288  sVaultDataType=type;
289 }

301 // This calculates an 8 character ascii checksum of the passed string.
302 // Used for generating the filename of the memory card file from the name the player has chosen.
303 
304 // It works by calculating a 32 bit checksum the usual way, then
305 // converting this number to base 26 and using 'a' to represent 0, 'b' for 1, etc.
306 // Log to base 26 of 2^32 is 6.8, which means at most 7 ascii characters will be needed, so the
307 // 8th letter in the string will actually always be a. So the last letter is used to indicate the file type.
308 static const char *s_generate_ascii_checksum(char *p_dest, const char *p_string, uint32 fileType)
309 {
310  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_dest,("NULL p_dest"));
311 
312  uint32 Checksum=Script::GenerateCRC(p_string);
313  for (int i=0; i<8; ++i)
314  {
315  int Rem=Checksum%26;
316  p_dest[i]='a'+Rem;
317  Checksum=(Checksum-Rem)/26;
318  }
319  // Check that mathematics is still working ok
320  Dbg_MsgAssert(Checksum==0,("Checksum not zero ???"));
321  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_dest[7]=='a',("Last letter of ascii checksum not 'a' ???"));
322 
323  switch (fileType)
324  {
325  case 0xb010f357: // OptionsAndPros
326  p_dest[7]='a'+MEMCARD_FILETYPE_CAREER;
327  break;
328  case 0xffc529f4: // Cas
329  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("CAS mem card files are no longer supported! Use OptionsAndPros file type instead"));
330  //p_dest[7]='a'+MEMCARD_FILETYPE_CAS;
331  break;
332  case 0x61a1bc57: // CAT
333  p_dest[7]='a'+MEMCARD_FILETYPE_CAT;
334  break;
335  case 0x3bf882cc: // Park
336  p_dest[7]='a'+MEMCARD_FILETYPE_PARK;
337  break;
338  case 0x26c80b0d: // Replay
339  p_dest[7]='a'+MEMCARD_FILETYPE_REPLAY;
340  break;
341  case 0xca41692d: // NetworkSettings
342  p_dest[7]='a'+MEMCARD_FILETYPE_NETWORKSETTINGS;
343  break;
344  case 0x62896edf: // CreatedGoals
345  p_dest[7]='a'+MEMCARD_FILETYPE_CREATEDGOALS;
346  break;
347  default:
348  break;
349  }
350 
351  p_dest[8]=0;
352  return p_dest;
353 }

360 static uint32 s_determine_file_type(char c)
361 {
362  switch (c-'a')
363  {
364  case MEMCARD_FILETYPE_CAREER:
365  return 0xb010f357; // OptionsAndPros
366  break;
367  case MEMCARD_FILETYPE_CAS:
368  return 0xffc529f4; // Cas
369  break;
370  case MEMCARD_FILETYPE_CAT:
371  return 0x61a1bc57; // CAT
372  break;
373  case MEMCARD_FILETYPE_PARK:
374  return 0x3bf882cc; // Park
375  break;
376  case MEMCARD_FILETYPE_REPLAY:
377  return 0x26c80b0d; // Replay
378  break;
379  case MEMCARD_FILETYPE_NETWORKSETTINGS:
380  return 0xca41692d; // NetworkSettings
381  break;
382  case MEMCARD_FILETYPE_CREATEDGOALS:
383  return 0x62896edf; // CreatedGoals
384  break;
385  default:
386  return 0;
387  break;
388  }
389 }

398 #ifndef __PLAT_NGC__
399 static unsigned short s_ascii_to_sjis(unsigned char ascii_code)
400 {
401  if (Config::PAL())
402  {
403  // The PS2 shell will not display underscores (it shows them as spaces)
404  // so convert them to hyphens.
405  if (ascii_code=='_')
406  {
407  ascii_code='-';
408  }
409  }
410 
411  switch ((char)ascii_code)
412  {
413  case '': ascii_code='B'; break;
414  case '': ascii_code='A'; break;
415  case '': ascii_code='U'; break;
416  case '': ascii_code='O'; break;
417  case '': ascii_code='a'; break;
418  case '': ascii_code='a'; break;
419  case '': ascii_code='a'; break;
420  case '': ascii_code='e'; break;
421  case '': ascii_code='e'; break;
422  case '': ascii_code='e'; break;
423  case '': ascii_code='e'; break;
424  case '': ascii_code='i'; break;
425  case '': ascii_code='i'; break;
426  case '': ascii_code='i'; break;
427  case '': ascii_code='o'; break;
428  case '': ascii_code='o'; break;
429  case '': ascii_code='o'; break;
430  case '': ascii_code='u'; break;
431  case '': ascii_code='u'; break;
432  case '': ascii_code='u'; break;
433  case '': ascii_code='c'; break;
434  case '': ascii_code='o'; break;
435  default: break;
436  }
437 
438  unsigned short sjis_code = 0;
439  unsigned char stmp=0;
440  unsigned char stmp2 = 0;
441 
442  if((ascii_code >= 0x20) && (ascii_code <= 0x2f))
443  stmp2 = 1;
444 
445  else if((ascii_code >= 0x30) && (ascii_code <= 0x39))
446  stmp = 0;
447 
448  else if((ascii_code >= 0x3a) && (ascii_code <= 0x40))
449  stmp2 = 11;
450 
451  else if((ascii_code >= 0x41) && (ascii_code <= 0x5a))
452  stmp = 1;
453 
454  else if((ascii_code >= 0x5b) && (ascii_code <= 0x60))
455  stmp2 = 37;
456 
457  else if((ascii_code >= 0x61) && (ascii_code <= 0x7a))
458  stmp = 2;
459 
460  else if((ascii_code >= 0x7b) && (ascii_code <= 0x7e))
461  stmp2 = 63;
462 
463  else
464  {
465  printf("bad ASCII code 0x%x\n", ascii_code);
466  return 0;
467  }
468 
469  if (stmp2)
470  sjis_code = s_ascii_special[ascii_code - 0x20 - (stmp2 - 1)][0];
471  else
472  sjis_code = s_ascii_table[stmp][0] + ascii_code - s_ascii_table[stmp][1];
473 
474  return sjis_code;
475 }
476 #endif // __PLAT_NGC__
477 
478 static void s_insert_global_info(CStruct *p_struct)
479 {
480  // Build the global options structure and insert it into p_struct.
481 
482  Script::CStruct *pOptions=new Script::CStruct;
483 
484  // Attach the split screen preferences.
485  Mdl::Skate * pSkate = Mdl::Skate::Instance();
486  Prefs::Preferences *pPreferences = pSkate->GetSplitScreenPreferences();
487  Dbg_MsgAssert(pPreferences,("NULL split screen pPreferences"));
488 
489  // Create a new structure, append the data contained in the preferences, then insert the pointer to the
490  // new structure into pOptions.
491  Script::CStruct *pTemp=new Script::CStruct;
492  pTemp->AppendStructure(pPreferences->GetRoot());
493  pOptions->AddStructurePointer(CRCD(0xf7720c3f,"SplitScreenPreferences"),pTemp);
494 
495  // Get the sound options and stick them in a structure and add that.
496  pTemp=new Script::CStruct;
497 
498  Sfx::CSfxManager * pSfxManager = Sfx::CSfxManager::Instance();
499  float MainVolume=pSfxManager->GetMainVolume();
500  pTemp->AddFloat(CRCD(0x6f016dfb,"MainVolume"),MainVolume);
501 
502  float MusicVolume=Pcm::GetVolume();
503  pTemp->AddFloat(CRCD(0xabd4a575,"MusicVolume"),MusicVolume);
504 
505  //uint64 PlayListForbiddenTrackFlags=Pcm::GetPlaylist();
506  uint64 list1,list2;
507  Pcm::GetPlaylist(&list1, &list2);
508 
509  uint32 PlayListForbiddenTrackFlags1=(uint32)(list1>>32);
510  uint32 PlayListForbiddenTrackFlags2=(uint32)list1;
511 
512  uint32 PlayListForbiddenTrackFlags3=(uint32)(list2>>32);
513  uint32 PlayListForbiddenTrackFlags4=(uint32)list2;
514 
515  pTemp->AddInteger(CRCD(0x595d2c95,"PlayListForbiddenTrackFlags1"),PlayListForbiddenTrackFlags1);
516  pTemp->AddInteger(CRCD(0xc0547d2f,"PlayListForbiddenTrackFlags2"),PlayListForbiddenTrackFlags2);
517  pTemp->AddInteger(CRCD(0xb7534db9,"PlayListForbiddenTrackFlags3"),PlayListForbiddenTrackFlags3);
518  pTemp->AddInteger(CRCD(0x2937d81a,"PlayListForbiddenTrackFlags4"),PlayListForbiddenTrackFlags4);
519 
520  // current_soundtrack only applies to XBox
521  if (Config::GetHardware()==Config::HARDWARE_XBOX)
522  {
523  pTemp->AddChecksum(CRCD(0xe1f7c4ae,"current_soundtrack"),Script::GetChecksum("current_soundtrack"));
524  }
525 
526  if (Pcm::GetRandomMode())
527  {
528  pTemp->AddChecksum(NONAME,CRCD(0x31c71b70,"RandomMode"));
529  }
530 
531  pOptions->AddStructurePointer(CRCD(0x89eb9738,"SoundOptions"),pTemp);
532 
533  // Add the controller preferences.
534  Script::CArray *pControllerPrefs=new Script::CArray;
535  pControllerPrefs->SetSizeAndType(Mdl::Skate::vMAX_SKATERS, ESYMBOLTYPE_STRUCTURE);
536  for (int i=0; i<Mdl::Skate::vMAX_SKATERS; ++i)
537  {
538  pTemp=new Script::CStruct;
539  if (pSkate->mp_controller_preferences[i].AutoKickOn)
540  {
541  pTemp->AddChecksum(NONAME,CRCD(0x1eef7085,"AutoKickOn"));
542  }
543  if (pSkate->mp_controller_preferences[i].SpinTapsOn)
544  {
545  pTemp->AddChecksum(NONAME,CRCD(0xa483ba67,"SpinTapsOn"));
546  }
547  if (pSkate->mp_controller_preferences[i].VibrationOn)
548  {
549  pTemp->AddChecksum(NONAME,CRCD(0x73cee124,"VibrationOn"));
550  }
551  pControllerPrefs->SetStructure(i,pTemp);
552  }
553 
554  pOptions->AddArrayPointer(CRCD(0x37bdb853,"ControllerPreferences"),pControllerPrefs);
555 
556  // Insert the taunt stuff
557  GameNet::Manager * pGamenet = GameNet::Manager::Instance();
558  pPreferences=pGamenet->GetTauntPreferences();
559  Dbg_MsgAssert(pPreferences,("NULL taunt pPreferences"));
560  pOptions->AddStructure(CRCD(0xe62b6586,"Taunts"),pPreferences->GetRoot());
561 
562  // Now insert the pointer to the newly constucted pOptions into the mem card structure.
563  p_struct->AddStructurePointer(CRCD(0x2fca0578,"Options"),pOptions);
564 
565  // save the career (Game progress, flags and gap checklist)
566  Mdl::Skate::Instance()->GetCareer()->WriteIntoStructure(p_struct);
567 
568  // Add the game records.
569  Records::CGameRecords *pGameRecords=pSkate->GetGameRecords();
570  Dbg_MsgAssert(pGameRecords,("NULL pGameRecords"));
571  pGameRecords->WriteIntoStructure(p_struct);
572 
573  // Wack in the pro skater profile info
574  Script::CStruct *p_pros=new Script::CStruct;
575  Obj::CPlayerProfileManager* pPlayerProfileManager=pSkate->GetPlayerProfileManager();
576  Dbg_MsgAssert(pPlayerProfileManager,("NULL pPlayerProfileManager"));
577  pPlayerProfileManager->AddAllProProfileInfo(p_pros);
578  p_struct->AddStructurePointer(CRCD(0xc9986baf,"Pros"),p_pros);
579 
580  // Note: Mustn't delete pOptions or the other structures created above
581  // since pointers to these have been given to p_struct.
582  // p_struct will clean them up when it gets deleted.
583 }
584 
585 static void s_insert_story_info(CStruct *p_struct)
586 {
587  // Save the goal manager parameters.
588  Game::CGoalManager* p_goal_manager=Game::GetGoalManager();
589  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_goal_manager,("NULL p_goal_manager"));
590 
591  CStruct *p_goal_manager_params=p_goal_manager->GetGoalManagerParams();
592  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_goal_manager_params,("NULL p_goal_manager_params"));
593  p_struct->AddStructure(CRCD(0xac7c2b62,"GoalManagerParams"),p_goal_manager_params);
594 }
595 
596 static void s_insert_story_skater_info(CStruct *p_struct)
597 {
598  Mdl::Skate * pSkate = Mdl::Skate::Instance();
599  Obj::CSkater* pSkater = pSkate->GetSkater(0);
600  Dbg_Assert( pSkater );
601  pSkater->AddCATInfo(p_struct);
602 
603  // stat goal status
604  pSkater->AddStatGoalInfo(p_struct);
605 
606  // chapter status
607  pSkater->AddChapterStatusInfo(p_struct);
608 }
609 
610 static void s_insert_custom_skater_info(CStruct *p_struct)
611 {
612  Mdl::Skate * pSkate = Mdl::Skate::Instance();
613  Obj::CPlayerProfileManager* pPlayerProfileManager=pSkate->GetPlayerProfileManager();
614  Dbg_MsgAssert(pPlayerProfileManager,("NULL pPlayerProfileManager"));
615 
616  pPlayerProfileManager->AddCASProfileInfo(p_struct);
617 }

619 /******************************************************************/

621 /* */
622 /******************************************************************/
623 
624 static void s_insert_game_save_info(uint32 fileType, CStruct *p_struct)
625 {
626  // WARNING ! WARNING ! WARNING ! WARNING ! WARNING !
627  // Make sure that no function in here stores any pointers to new CStructs.
628  // This is because all new CStructs (and CComponents) allocated here will be coming
629  // off a special pool, to avoid overflowing the regular pool.
630 
631  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_struct,("NULL p_struct"));
632 
633  Mdl::Skate * pSkate = Mdl::Skate::Instance();
634  #ifdef __NOPT_ASSERT__
635  #if 0 // Actually remove it fully, as the code that uses it had been temp stubbed out,a nd we don't want to confuse the non final build into thinking it's there
636  Obj::CPlayerProfileManager* pPlayerProfileManager=pSkate->GetPlayerProfileManager();
637  Dbg_MsgAssert(pPlayerProfileManager,("NULL pPlayerProfileManager"));
638  #endif
639  #endif
640 
641  switch (fileType)
642  {
643  case 0xb010f357: // OptionsAndPros
644  {
645  Script::CStruct *p_global_info=new Script::CStruct;
646  s_insert_global_info(p_global_info);
647  p_struct->AddStructurePointer(CRCD(0xf55cbd13,"GlobalInfo"),p_global_info);
648 
649  Script::CStruct *p_story=new Script::CStruct;
650  s_insert_story_info(p_story);
651  p_struct->AddStructurePointer(CRCD(0x14a9fbc7,"Story"),p_story);
652 
653  Script::CStruct *p_story_skater=new Script::CStruct;
654  s_insert_story_skater_info(p_story_skater);
655  p_struct->AddStructurePointer(CRCD(0xdf2f448,"StorySkater"),p_story_skater);
656 
657  Script::CStruct *p_custom_skater=new Script::CStruct;
658  s_insert_custom_skater_info(p_custom_skater);
659  p_struct->AddStructurePointer(CRCD(0x12bfac82,"CustomSkater"),p_custom_skater);
660  break;
661  }
662 
663  case 0xca41692d: // NetworkSettings
664  {
665  // Add the network preferences
666  GameNet::Manager * pGamenet = GameNet::Manager::Instance();
667  Prefs::Preferences *pPreferences=pGamenet->GetNetworkPreferences();
668  p_struct->AppendStructure(pPreferences->GetRoot());
669  break;
670  }
671 
672  case 0xffc529f4: // Cas
673  {
674  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("CAS mem card files are no longer supported! Use OptionsAndPros file type instead"));
675  /*
676  pPlayerProfileManager->AddCASProfileInfo(p_struct);
677 
678  Obj::CSkater* pSkater = pSkate->GetSkater(0);
679  Dbg_Assert( pSkater );
680  pSkater->AddCATInfo(p_struct);
681  */
682  break;
683  }
684 
685  case 0x61a1bc57: // Cat
686  {
687  // Can only edit CAT on skater zero!
688  Obj::CSkater* pSkater = pSkate->GetSkater(0);
689  Dbg_Assert( pSkater );
690 
691  // Index is always 0 since that is the only one that can be edited directly.
692  Game::CCreateATrick* pCreatedTrick = pSkater->m_created_trick[0];
693  Dbg_Assert( pCreatedTrick );
694 
695  //Other params
696  p_struct->AddStructure( "other_params", pCreatedTrick->mp_other_params );
697 
698  //Rotation params
699  p_struct->AddArray( "rotation_info", pCreatedTrick->mp_rotations );
700 
701  //Animation params
702  p_struct->AddArray( "animation_info", pCreatedTrick->mp_animations );
703 
704  break;
705  }
706 
707  case 0x3bf882cc: // Park (Save)
708  {
709  Ed::CParkManager::Instance()->WriteIntoStructure(p_struct);
710  break;
711  }
712 
713  case 0x26c80b0d: // Replay
714  {
715 #if __USE_REPLAYS__
716  Replay::AddReplayMemCardInfo(p_struct);
717 #endif
718  break;
719  }
720 
721  case 0x62896edf: // CreatedGoals
722  {
723  Obj::CCompositeObject *p_obj=(Obj::CCompositeObject*)Obj::CTracker::Instance()->GetObject(CRCD(0x81f01058,"GoalEditor"));
724  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_obj,("No GoalEditor object"));
725  Obj::CGoalEditorComponent *p_goal_editor=GetGoalEditorComponentFromObject(p_obj);
726  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_goal_editor,("No goal editor component ???"));
727  p_goal_editor->WriteIntoStructure(p_struct);
728  break;
729  }
730 
731  default:
732  {
733  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("Bad type of '%s' sent to s_insert_game_save_info",FindChecksumName(fileType)));
734  break;
735  }
736  }
737 }
738 
739 /******************************************************************/
740 /* */
741 /* */
742 /******************************************************************/

744 // Inserts summary info for the specified file type into p_struct.
745 // Summary info is a small amount of info that is written at the start of the mem card file
746 // so that it can be quickly read out without having to read the whole file.
747 // The info gets printed at the bottom of the files menu when the highlight is on a file.
748 static void s_generate_summary_info(CStruct *p_summaryInfo, uint32 fileType, CStruct *p_mainData)
749 {
750  // WARNING ! WARNING ! WARNING ! WARNING ! WARNING !
751  // Make sure that no function in here stores any pointers to new CStructs.
752  // This is because all new CStructs (and CComponents) allocated here will be coming
753  // off a special pool, to avoid overflowing the regular pool.
754 
755  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_summaryInfo,("NULL p_summaryInfo"));
756 
757  if (p_mainData)
758  {
759  // Extract the summary info from the passed p_mainData.
760  // This is for when the save process is being done on data that got downloaded from the vault.
761 
762  switch (fileType)
763  {
764  case 0xb010f357: // OptionsAndPros
765  {
766  Script::CStruct *p_story=NULL;
767  p_mainData->GetStructure(CRCD(0x14a9fbc7,"Story"),&p_story,Script::ASSERT);
768 
769  Script::CStruct *p_goal_manager_params=NULL;
770  p_story->GetStructure(CRCD(0xac7c2b62,"GoalManagerParams"),&p_goal_manager_params,Script::ASSERT);
771 
772  CStruct *p_more_goal_manager_params=NULL;
773  p_goal_manager_params->GetStructure(CRCD(0x23d4170a,"GoalManager_Params"),&p_more_goal_manager_params,Script::ASSERT);
774 
775  int chapter=0;
776  p_more_goal_manager_params->GetInteger(CRCD(0xf884773c,"CurrentChapter"),&chapter);
777  p_summaryInfo->AddInteger(CRCD(0xf884773c,"CurrentChapter"),chapter);
778 
779  // is_male is used by the script upload_content in net.q
780  Script::CStruct *p_custom_skater=NULL;
781  p_mainData->GetStructure(CRCD(0x12bfac82,"CustomSkater"),&p_custom_skater,Script::ASSERT);
782  Script::CStruct *p_custom=NULL;
783  p_custom_skater->GetStructure(CRCD(0xa7be964,"Custom"),&p_custom,Script::ASSERT);
784  Script::CStruct *p_info=NULL;
785  p_custom->GetStructure(CRCD(0x3476cea8,"Info"),&p_info,Script::ASSERT);
786  int is_male=0;
787  p_info->GetInteger(CRCD(0x3f813177,"is_male"),&is_male);
788  p_summaryInfo->AddInteger(CRCD(0x3f813177,"is_male"),is_male);
789  const char *p_name="";
790  p_info->GetString(CRCD(0x2ab66cb8,"display_name"),&p_name);
791  p_summaryInfo->AddString(CRCD(0xa1dc81f9,"name"),p_name);
792  break;
793  }
794 
795  case 0xca41692d: // NetworkSettings
796  {
797  p_summaryInfo->AddString("network_id","");
798  break;
799  }
800 
801  case 0xffc529f4: // Cas
802  {
803  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("CAS mem card files are no longer supported! Use OptionsAndPros file type instead"));
804  break;
805  }
806 
807  case 0x61a1bc57: // Cat
808  {
809  Script::CStruct *p_data=NULL;
810  p_mainData->GetStructure(CRCD(0x4137cb14,"other_params"),&p_data,Script::ASSERT);
811 
812  const char *p_name="";
813  p_data->GetString(CRCD(0xa1dc81f9,"name"),&p_name,Script::ASSERT);
814 
815  p_summaryInfo->AddString(CRCD(0xa1dc81f9,"name"),p_name);
816  break;
817  }
818 
819  case 0x26c80b0d: // Replay
820  {
821  break;
822  }
823 
824  case 0x3bf882cc: // Park
825  {
826  int num_edited_goals=0;
827 
828  Script::CArray *p_goals=NULL;
829  Script::CStruct *p_goals_struct=NULL;
830  p_mainData->GetStructure(CRCD(0xd8eb825e,"Park_editor_goals"),&p_goals_struct);
831  if (p_goals_struct)
832  {
833  p_goals_struct->GetArray(CRCD(0x38dbe1d0,"Goals"),&p_goals);
834  if (p_goals)
835  {
836  num_edited_goals=p_goals->GetSize();
837  }
838  }
839  p_summaryInfo->AddInteger(CRCD(0xe1ec606f,"num_edited_goals"),num_edited_goals);
840 
841  int max_players=1;
842  p_mainData->GetInteger(CRCD(0xb7e39b53,"MaxPlayers"),&max_players);
843  p_summaryInfo->AddInteger(CRCD(0xb7e39b53,"MaxPlayers"),max_players);
844 
845  Script::CArray *p_map=NULL;
846  p_mainData->GetArray(CRCD(0x337c5289,"Park_editor_map"),&p_map,Script::ASSERT);
847 
848  // Used by the script upload_content in net.q
849  int num_gaps=0;
850  int num_metas=0;
851  uint16 theme=0;
852  uint32 tod_script=0;
853  int width=0;
854  int length=0;
855  Ed::CParkManager::Instance()->GetSummaryInfoFromBuffer((uint8*)p_map->GetArrayPointer(),&num_gaps,&num_metas,&theme,&tod_script,&width,&length);
856  p_summaryInfo->AddInteger(CRCD(0xe6121ed0,"num_gaps"),num_gaps);
857  p_summaryInfo->AddInteger(CRCD(0xfff3dc35,"num_pieces"),num_metas);
858  p_summaryInfo->AddInteger(CRCD(0x688a18f7,"theme"),theme);
859  p_summaryInfo->AddChecksum(CRCD(0x4c72ed98,"tod_script"),tod_script);
860  p_summaryInfo->AddInteger(CRCD(0x73e5bad0,"width"),width);
861  p_summaryInfo->AddInteger(CRCD(0xfe82614d,"length"),length);
862  break;
863  }
864 
865  case 0x62896edf: // CreatedGoals
866  {
867  int num_edited_goals=0;
868 
869  Script::CArray *p_goals=NULL;
870  p_mainData->GetArray(CRCD(0x38dbe1d0,"Goals"),&p_goals);
871  if (p_goals)
872  {
873  num_edited_goals=p_goals->GetSize();
874  }
875  p_summaryInfo->AddInteger(CRCD(0xe1ec606f,"num_edited_goals"),num_edited_goals);
876  break;
877  }
878 
879  default:
880  {
881  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("Bad type of '%s' sent to s_generate_summary_info",FindChecksumName(fileType)));
882  break;
883  }
884  }
885  }
886  else
887  {
888  // Get the summary info from the game.
889 
890  switch (fileType)
891  {
892  case 0xb010f357: // OptionsAndPros
893  {
894  Game::CGoalManager* p_goal_manager=Game::GetGoalManager();
895  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_goal_manager,("NULL p_goal_manager"));
896 
897  CStruct *p_goal_manager_params=p_goal_manager->GetGoalManagerParams();
898  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_goal_manager_params,("NULL p_goal_manager_params"));
899 
900  // Grab the summary info.
901  CStruct *p_more_goal_manager_params=NULL;
902  p_goal_manager_params->GetStructure(CRCD(0x23d4170a,"GoalManager_Params"),&p_more_goal_manager_params);
903  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_more_goal_manager_params,("No GoalManager_Params structure ??"));
904 
905  int chapter=0;
906  p_more_goal_manager_params->GetInteger(CRCD(0xf884773c,"CurrentChapter"),&chapter);
907  p_summaryInfo->AddInteger(CRCD(0xf884773c,"CurrentChapter"),chapter);
908  break;
909  }
910 
911  case 0xca41692d: // NetworkSettings
912  {
913  GameNet::Manager * pGamenet = GameNet::Manager::Instance();
914  Prefs::Preferences *pPreferences=pGamenet->GetNetworkPreferences();
915  CStruct *p_net_stuff=pPreferences->GetRoot();
916 
917  // Grab the summary info.
918  CStruct *p_foo=NULL;
919  p_net_stuff->GetStructure("network_id",&p_foo);
920  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_foo,("No network_id structure ?"));
921 
922  const char *p_name="";
923  p_foo->GetString("ui_string",&p_name);
924 
925  p_summaryInfo->AddString("network_id",p_name);
926  break;
927  }
928 
929  case 0xffc529f4: // Cas
930  {
931  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("CAS mem card files are no longer supported! Use OptionsAndPros file type instead"));
932  break;
933  }
934 
935  case 0x61a1bc57: // Cat
936  {
937  // Can only edit CAT on skater zero!
938  Mdl::Skate * pSkate = Mdl::Skate::Instance();
939  Obj::CSkater* pSkater = pSkate->GetSkater(0);
940  Dbg_Assert( pSkater );
941 
942  // Index is always 0 since that is the only one that can be edited directly.
943  Game::CCreateATrick* pCreatedTrick = pSkater->m_created_trick[0];
944  Dbg_Assert( pCreatedTrick );
945 
946  const char *p_name="";
947  pCreatedTrick->mp_other_params->GetString(CRCD(0xa1dc81f9,"name"),&p_name,Script::ASSERT);
948 
949  p_summaryInfo->AddString(CRCD(0xa1dc81f9,"name"),p_name);
950  break;
951  }
952 
953  case 0x26c80b0d: // Replay
954  {
955  #if __USE_REPLAYS__
956  Replay::AddReplayMemCardSummaryInfo(p_summaryInfo);
957  #endif
958  break;
959  }
960 
961  case 0x3bf882cc: // Park
962  case 0x62896edf: // CreatedGoals
963  {
964  Obj::CCompositeObject *p_obj=(Obj::CCompositeObject*)Obj::CTracker::Instance()->GetObject(CRCD(0x81f01058,"GoalEditor"));
965  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_obj,("No GoalEditor object"));
966  Obj::CGoalEditorComponent *p_goal_editor=GetGoalEditorComponentFromObject(p_obj);
967  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_goal_editor,("No goal editor component ???"));
968 
969  p_summaryInfo->AddInteger(CRCD(0xe1ec606f,"num_edited_goals"),p_goal_editor->GetNumGoals());
970 
971  if (fileType==CRCD(0x3bf882cc,"Park"))
972  {
973  p_summaryInfo->AddInteger(CRCD(0xb7e39b53,"MaxPlayers"),Ed::CParkManager::Instance()->GetGenerator()->GetMaxPlayers());
974 
975  int num_gaps=0;
976  int num_metas=0;
977  uint16 theme=0;
978  uint32 tod_script=0;
979  int width=0;
980  int length=0;
981  Ed::CParkManager::Instance()->WriteCompressedMapBuffer(); // Ensure map buffer is correct
982  Ed::CParkManager::Instance()->GetSummaryInfoFromBuffer(Ed::CParkManager::Instance()->GetCompressedMapBuffer(),&num_gaps,&num_metas,&theme,&tod_script,&width,&length);
983  p_summaryInfo->AddInteger(CRCD(0xe6121ed0,"num_gaps"),num_gaps);
984  p_summaryInfo->AddInteger(CRCD(0xfff3dc35,"num_pieces"),num_metas);
985  p_summaryInfo->AddInteger(CRCD(0x688a18f7,"theme"),theme);
986  p_summaryInfo->AddChecksum(CRCD(0x4c72ed98,"tod_script"),tod_script);
987  p_summaryInfo->AddInteger(CRCD(0x73e5bad0,"width"),width);
988  p_summaryInfo->AddInteger(CRCD(0xfe82614d,"length"),length);
989  }
990  break;
991  }
992 
993  default:
994  {
995  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("Bad type of '%s' sent to s_generate_summary_info",FindChecksumName(fileType)));
996  break;
997  }
998  }
999  }
1000 }
1001 
1002 static void s_read_global_info(CStruct *p_globalInfo, CScript *p_script)
1003 {
1004  Mdl::Skate * pSkate = Mdl::Skate::Instance();
1005 
1006  Script::CStruct *pOptions=NULL;
1007  p_globalInfo->GetStructure(CRCD(0x2fca0578,"Options"),&pOptions);
1008  Dbg_MsgAssert(pOptions,("p_globalInfo is missing Options structure"));
1009 
1010  // Extract the split screen preferences
1011  Script::CStruct *pTemp=NULL;
1012  pOptions->GetStructure(CRCD(0xf7720c3f,"SplitScreenPreferences"),&pTemp);
1013 
1014  Prefs::Preferences *pPreferences = pSkate->GetSplitScreenPreferences();
1015  Dbg_MsgAssert(pPreferences,("NULL split screen pPreferences"));
1016  pPreferences->SetRoot(pTemp);
1017 
1018  // Get the taunt preferences
1019  pTemp=NULL;
1020  pOptions->GetStructure(CRCD(0xe62b6586,"Taunts"),&pTemp);
1021 
1022  GameNet::Manager * pGamenet = GameNet::Manager::Instance();
1023  pPreferences=pGamenet->GetTauntPreferences();
1024  Dbg_MsgAssert(pPreferences,("NULL taunt pPreferences"));
1025  pPreferences->SetRoot(pTemp);
1026 
1027 
1028  // Get the sound options.
1029  pOptions->GetStructure(CRCD(0x89eb9738,"SoundOptions"),&pTemp);
1030  Sfx::CSfxManager * pSfxManager = Sfx::CSfxManager::Instance();
1031  float MainVolume=0;
1032  if (pTemp->GetFloat(CRCD(0x6f016dfb,"MainVolume"),&MainVolume))
1033  {
1034  pSfxManager->SetMainVolume(MainVolume);
1035  }
1036 
1037  float MusicVolume=0;
1038  if (pTemp->GetFloat(CRCD(0xabd4a575,"MusicVolume"),&MusicVolume))
1039  {
1040  Pcm::SetVolume(MusicVolume);
1041  }
1042 
1043  uint64 PlayListForbiddenTrackFlagsA=0;
1044  uint64 PlayListForbiddenTrackFlagsB=0;
1045  uint32 PlayListForbiddenTrackFlags1=0;
1046  uint32 PlayListForbiddenTrackFlags2=0;
1047  uint32 PlayListForbiddenTrackFlags3=0;
1048  uint32 PlayListForbiddenTrackFlags4=0;
1049 
1050  if (pTemp->GetInteger(CRCD(0x595d2c95,"PlayListForbiddenTrackFlags1"),(int*)&PlayListForbiddenTrackFlags1))
1051  {
1052  pTemp->GetInteger(CRCD(0xc0547d2f,"PlayListForbiddenTrackFlags2"),(int*)&PlayListForbiddenTrackFlags2);
1053  pTemp->GetInteger(CRCD(0xb7534db9,"PlayListForbiddenTrackFlags3"),(int*)&PlayListForbiddenTrackFlags3);
1054  pTemp->GetInteger(CRCD(0x2937d81a,"PlayListForbiddenTrackFlags4"),(int*)&PlayListForbiddenTrackFlags4);
1055 
1056  PlayListForbiddenTrackFlagsA=(((uint64)PlayListForbiddenTrackFlags1)<<32)+PlayListForbiddenTrackFlags2;
1057  PlayListForbiddenTrackFlagsB=(((uint64)PlayListForbiddenTrackFlags3)<<32)+PlayListForbiddenTrackFlags4;
1058  Pcm::SetPlaylist(PlayListForbiddenTrackFlagsA, PlayListForbiddenTrackFlagsB);
1059  }
1060 
1061  if (pTemp->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0x31c71b70,"RandomMode")))
1062  {
1063  Pcm::SetRandomMode(true);
1064  }
1065  else
1066  {
1067  Pcm::SetRandomMode(false);
1068  }
1069 
1070  if (Config::GetHardware()==Config::HARDWARE_XBOX)
1071  {
1072  uint32 current_soundtrack=0xffffffff;
1073  pTemp->GetChecksum(CRCD(0xe1f7c4ae,"current_soundtrack"),&current_soundtrack);
1074 
1075  Script::CSymbolTableEntry *p_sym=Script::LookUpSymbol(0xe1f7c4ae/*current_soundtrack*/);
1076  if (p_sym)
1077  {
1078  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_sym->mType==ESYMBOLTYPE_NAME,("Expected current_soundtrack to have type checksum"));
1079  p_sym->mChecksum=current_soundtrack;
1080  }
1081  Script::CStruct* pTemp2 = new Script::CStruct;
1082  pTemp2->AddChecksum(CRCD(0x8c465905,"trackchecksum"),current_soundtrack);
1083  Script::RunScript(CRCD(0xd44400c2,"set_loaded_soundtrack"), pTemp2);
1084  }
1085 
1086  // Extract the controller preferences
1087  Script::CArray *pControllerPrefs=NULL;
1088  if (pOptions->GetArray(CRCD(0x37bdb853,"ControllerPreferences"),&pControllerPrefs))
1089  {
1090  for (int i=0; i<Mdl::Skate::vMAX_SKATERS; ++i)
1091  {
1092  Script::CStruct *pPrefs=pControllerPrefs->GetStructure(i);
1093  Dbg_MsgAssert(pPrefs,("NULL pPrefs?"));
1094 
1095  pSkate->SetVibration(i,pPrefs->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0x73cee124,"VibrationOn")));
1096  pSkate->SetAutoKick(i,pPrefs->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0x1eef7085,"AutoKickOn")));
1097  pSkate->SetSpinTaps(i,pPrefs->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0xa483ba67,"SpinTapsOn")));
1098  }
1099  }
1100 
1101  // Extract the game records.
1102  Records::CGameRecords *pGameRecords=pSkate->GetGameRecords();
1103  Dbg_MsgAssert(pGameRecords,("NULL pGameRecords"));
1104  pGameRecords->ReadFromStructure(p_globalInfo);
1105 
1106  // Extract the pro & cas skater profile info
1107  Script::CStruct *p_pros=NULL;
1108  p_globalInfo->GetStructure(CRCD(0xc9986baf,"Pros"),&p_pros,Script::ASSERT);
1109  Obj::CPlayerProfileManager* pPlayerProfileManager=pSkate->GetPlayerProfileManager();
1110  pPlayerProfileManager->LoadAllProProfileInfo(p_pros);
1111 
1112  // Extract the career info (Game progress, flags and gap checklist)
1113  Mdl::Skate::Instance()->GetCareer()->ReadFromStructure(p_globalInfo);
1114 
1115  // Return the LastLevelLoadScript and LastGameMode to the calling script.
1116  // Needed by Zac so that after autoloading the game can automatically load up the
1117  // last level that was being played when saved.
1118  uint32 last_level_load_script=0;
1119  uint32 last_game_mode=0;
1120  CStruct *p_career=NULL;
1121  int current_theme=0;
1122  p_globalInfo->GetStructure(CRCD(0x4da4937b,"Career"),&p_career);
1123  if (p_career)
1124  {
1125  p_career->GetChecksum(CRCD(0xe3335d2f,"LastLevelLoadScript"),&last_level_load_script);
1126  p_career->GetChecksum(CRCD(0x2cc06f5e,"LastGameMode"),&last_game_mode);
1127  // Extract current theme
1128  p_career->GetInteger(CRCD(0xcc946ff3,"current_theme"),&current_theme);
1129  }
1130  if (last_level_load_script)
1131  {
1132  p_script->GetParams()->AddChecksum(CRCD(0xe3335d2f,"LastLevelLoadScript"),last_level_load_script);
1133  }
1134  if (last_game_mode)
1135  {
1136  p_script->GetParams()->AddChecksum(CRCD(0x2cc06f5e,"LastGameMode"),last_game_mode);
1137  }
1138  //if (current_theme) TT7448: current_theme can be saved as zero
1139  //{
1140  Script::CStruct* pTemp2 = new Script::CStruct;
1141  pTemp2->AddInteger(CRCD(0x3bed2cf5,"theme_num"),current_theme);
1142  pTemp2->AddChecksum(CRCD(0x476cdadd,"loading_career"),0);
1143  Script::RunScript( "set_current_theme", pTemp2 );
1144  delete pTemp2;
1145  // }
1146 
1147  // Now, if the skater is custom, set his cas file name.
1148  Obj::CSkaterProfile* pSkaterProfile=pSkate->GetCurrentProfile();
1149  if (!pSkaterProfile->IsPro())
1150  {
1151  const char *pCASFileName="Unimplemented";
1152  p_globalInfo->GetString(CRCD(0xf36c1878,"CASFileName"),&pCASFileName);
1153  pSkaterProfile->SetCASFileName(pCASFileName);
1154  }
1155 }

1157 static void s_read_story_info(CStruct *p_storyInfo)
1158 {
1159  // Load in the goal manager parameters.
1160  CStruct *p_loaded_goal_manager_params=NULL;
1161  p_storyInfo->GetStructure(CRCD(0xac7c2b62,"GoalManagerParams"),&p_loaded_goal_manager_params);
1162  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_loaded_goal_manager_params,("No goal manager params on mem card"));
1163 
1164  Game::CGoalManager* p_goal_manager=Game::GetGoalManager();
1165  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_goal_manager,("NULL p_goal_manager"));
1166 
1167  p_goal_manager->ResetCareer();
1168 
1169  CStruct *p_goal_manager_params=p_goal_manager->GetGoalManagerParams();
1170  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_goal_manager_params,("NULL p_goal_manager_params"));
1171 
1172  p_goal_manager_params->Clear();
1173  p_goal_manager_params->AppendStructure(p_loaded_goal_manager_params);
1174 
1175  // Refresh the goal manager with the new params.
1176  p_goal_manager->LevelLoad();
1177 }

1179 static void s_read_story_skater_info(CStruct *p_storySkaterInfo, CStruct *p_customSkater)
1180 {
1181  // Which skater are we loading?
1182  Mdl::Skate * pSkate = Mdl::Skate::Instance();
1183 
1184  Obj::CPlayerProfileManager* pPlayerProfileManager=pSkate->GetPlayerProfileManager();
1185  int index = pPlayerProfileManager->GetCurrentProfileIndex();
1186  Dbg_MsgAssert(index==0,("Should not be loading story skater info into any skater other than skater 0, tried to load it into skater %d",index));
1187 
1188  Obj::CSkater* pSkater = pSkate->GetSkater(index);
1189  Dbg_Assert( pSkater );
1190  pSkater->LoadCATInfo(p_storySkaterInfo);
1191  pSkater->LoadStatGoalInfo(p_storySkaterInfo);
1192  pSkater->LoadChapterStatusInfo(p_storySkaterInfo);
1193 
1194  pPlayerProfileManager->LoadCASProfileInfo(p_customSkater, true);
1195 }

1197 static void s_read_custom_skater_info(CStruct *p_customSkater)
1198 {
1199  Mdl::Skate * pSkate = Mdl::Skate::Instance();
1200 
1201  Obj::CPlayerProfileManager* pPlayerProfileManager=pSkate->GetPlayerProfileManager();
1202  int index = pPlayerProfileManager->GetCurrentProfileIndex();
1203 
1204  if ( index == 0 )
1205  {
1206  // if this is player one... don't apply the stats
1207  pPlayerProfileManager->LoadCASProfileInfo(p_customSkater, false);
1208  }
1209  else
1210  {
1211  // if this is any other skater, then apply the stats
1212  pPlayerProfileManager->LoadCASProfileInfo(p_customSkater, true);
1213  }
1214 
1215 }

1217 uint32 s_apply_flags=0;
1218 bool s_did_apply_custom_skater_info=false;
1219 static void s_read_game_save_info(uint32 fileType, CStruct *p_struct, CScript *p_script)
1220 {
1221  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_struct,("NULL p_struct"));
1222  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_script,("NULL p_script"));
1223 
1224  s_did_apply_custom_skater_info=false;
1225 
1226  switch (fileType)
1227  {
1228  case 0xb010f357: // OptionsAndPros
1229  {
1230  Dbg_MsgAssert(s_apply_flags,("s_apply_flags is zero, need to call SetSectionsToApplyWhenLoading"));
1231 
1232  if (s_apply_flags & (1<<APPLY_GLOBAL_INFO))
1233  {
1234  printf("APPLY_GLOBAL_INFO\n");
1235  Script::CStruct *p_global_info=NULL;
1236  p_struct->GetStructure(CRCD(0xf55cbd13,"GlobalInfo"),&p_global_info,Script::ASSERT);
1237  s_read_global_info(p_global_info, p_script);
1238  }
1239 
1240  if (s_apply_flags & (1<<APPLY_STORY))
1241  {
1242  // Must do this before the story skater is loaded
1243  // so that the proper difficulty is set
1244  // when the stat goals get loaded
1245  printf("APPLY_STORY\n");
1246  Script::CStruct *p_story_info=NULL;
1247  p_struct->GetStructure(CRCD(0x14a9fbc7,"Story"),&p_story_info,Script::ASSERT);
1248  s_read_story_info(p_story_info);
1249  }
1250 
1251  if (s_apply_flags & (1<<APPLY_CUSTOM_SKATER))
1252  {
1253  printf("APPLY_CUSTOM_SKATER\n");
1254  Script::CStruct *p_custom_skater_info=NULL;
1255  p_struct->GetStructure(CRCD(0x12bfac82,"CustomSkater"),&p_custom_skater_info,Script::ASSERT);
1256  s_read_custom_skater_info(p_custom_skater_info);
1257  s_did_apply_custom_skater_info=true;
1258  }
1259 
1260  if (s_apply_flags & (1<<APPLY_STORY_SKATER))
1261  {
1262  printf("APPLY_STORY_SKATER\n");
1263  Script::CStruct *p_story_skater_info=NULL;
1264  p_struct->GetStructure(CRCD(0xdf2f448,"StorySkater"),&p_story_skater_info,Script::ASSERT);
1265  Script::CStruct *p_custom_skater_info=NULL;
1266  p_struct->GetStructure(CRCD(0x12bfac82,"CustomSkater"),&p_custom_skater_info,Script::ASSERT);
1267  s_read_story_skater_info(p_story_skater_info,p_custom_skater_info);
1268  }
1269 
1270  // Reset the flags to that the above assert will catch cases where the scripts
1271  // have not called SetSectionsToApplyWhenLoading
1272  s_apply_flags=0;
1273  break;
1274  }
1275 
1276  case 0xca41692d: // NetworkSettings
1277  {
1278  // Extract the network preferences
1279  GameNet::Manager * pGamenet = GameNet::Manager::Instance();
1280  Prefs::Preferences *pPreferences=pGamenet->GetNetworkPreferences();
1281  Dbg_MsgAssert(pPreferences,("NULL network pPreferences"));
1282  pPreferences->SetRoot(p_struct);
1283  break;
1284  }
1285 
1286  case 0xffc529f4: // Cas
1287  {
1288  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("CAS mem card files are no longer supported! Use OptionsAndPros file type instead"));
1289  /*
1290  Mdl::Skate * pSkate = Mdl::Skate::Instance();
1291  Obj::CPlayerProfileManager* pPlayerProfileManager=pSkate->GetPlayerProfileManager();
1292  //Script::PrintContents( p_struct );
1293  pPlayerProfileManager->LoadCASProfileInfo(p_struct);
1294 
1295  // Which skater are we loading?
1296  int index = pPlayerProfileManager->GetCurrentProfileIndex();
1297 
1298  Obj::CSkater* pSkater = pSkate->GetSkater(index);
1299  Dbg_Assert( pSkater );
1300  pSkater->LoadCATInfo(p_struct);
1301  */
1302  break;
1303  }
1304 
1305  case 0x61a1bc57: // Cat
1306  {
1307  Mdl::Skate * pSkate = Mdl::Skate::Instance();
1308 
1309  Script::CStruct *p_other_params;
1310  Script::CArray *p_rotation_info;
1311  Script::CArray *p_animation_info;
1312 
1313  Obj::CSkater* pSkater = pSkate->GetLocalSkater();
1314  if ( pSkater )
1315  {
1316  //Params
1317  p_struct->GetStructure( "other_params", &p_other_params, Script::ASSERT );
1318  //pSkater->m_created_trick[0]->mp_other_params = p_other_params;
1319  pSkater->m_created_trick[0]->mp_other_params->AppendStructure( p_other_params );
1320 
1321  //Rotations
1322  p_struct->GetArray( "rotation_info", &p_rotation_info, Script::ASSERT );
1323  Script::CopyArray( pSkater->m_created_trick[0]->mp_rotations, p_rotation_info );
1324 
1325  //Animations
1326  p_struct->GetArray( "animation_info", &p_animation_info, Script::ASSERT );
1327  Script::CopyArray( pSkater->m_created_trick[0]->mp_animations, p_animation_info );
1328  }
1329  break;
1330  }
1331 
1332  case 0x3bf882cc: // Park (read save game info)
1333  {
1334  Ed::CParkManager::Instance()->ReadFromStructure(p_struct);
1335  break;
1336  }
1337 
1338  case 0x26c80b0d: // Replay
1339  {
1340 #if __USE_REPLAYS__
1341  uint32 level_structure_name=0;
1342  p_struct->GetChecksum("level_structure_name",&level_structure_name);
1343  Replay::SetLevelStructureName(level_structure_name);
1344 
1345  // Look up the load_script in the level structure, and return it to the calling
1346  // script so that after calling LoadFromMemoryCard the script can call the load_script,
1347  // which will load the appropriate level.
1348  CStruct *p_level_structure=GetStructure(level_structure_name);
1349  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_level_structure,("Could not find level structure '%s'",FindChecksumName(level_structure_name)));
1350 
1351  uint32 load_script=0;
1352  p_level_structure->GetChecksum("load_script",&load_script);
1353  p_script->GetParams()->AddChecksum("load_script",load_script);
1354 #endif
1355  break;
1356  }
1357 
1358  case 0x62896edf: // CreatedGoals
1359  {
1360  Obj::CCompositeObject *p_obj=(Obj::CCompositeObject*)Obj::CTracker::Instance()->GetObject(CRCD(0x81f01058,"GoalEditor"));
1361  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_obj,("No GoalEditor object"));
1362  Obj::CGoalEditorComponent *p_goal_editor=GetGoalEditorComponentFromObject(p_obj);
1363  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_goal_editor,("No goal editor component ???"));
1364 
1365  p_goal_editor->ReadFromStructure(p_struct);
1366  break;
1367  }
1368 
1369  default:
1370  {
1371  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("Bad type of '%s' sent to s_read_game_save_info",FindChecksumName(fileType)));
1372  break;
1373  }
1374  }
1375 }

1382 static int s_get_icon_k_required(uint32 fileType)
1383 {
1384  switch (fileType)
1385  {
1386  case 0xb010f357: // OptionsAndPros
1387  return Script::GetInteger(CRCD(0x4925ed9e,"OptionsProsIconSpaceRequired"));
1388  break;
1389  case 0xca41692d: // NetworkSettings
1390  return Script::GetInteger(CRCD(0xf3431f63,"NetworkSettingsIconSpaceRequired"));
1391  break;
1392  case 0xffc529f4: // Cas
1393  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("CAS mem card files are no longer supported! Use OptionsAndPros file type instead"));
1394  //return Script::GetInteger("CASIconSpaceRequired");
1395  break;
1396  case 0x61a1bc57: // Cat
1397  return Script::GetInteger(CRCD(0x46b0ef40,"CATIconSpaceRequired"));
1398  break;
1399  case 0x3bf882cc: // Park
1400  return Script::GetInteger(CRCD(0x82aaf8dc,"ParkIconSpaceRequired"));
1401  break;
1402  case 0x26c80b0d: // Replay
1403  return Script::GetInteger(CRCD(0x7eaf934f,"ReplayIconSpaceRequired"));
1404  break;
1405  case 0x62896edf: // CreatedGoals
1406  return Script::GetInteger(CRCD(0x3205bc07,"CreatedGoalsIconSpaceRequired"));
1407  break;
1408  default:
1409  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("Bad fileType of '%s' sent to s_get_icon_k_required",FindChecksumName(fileType)));
1410  break;
1411  }
1412 
1413  return 0;
1414 }

1421 static int s_calculate_total_space_used_on_card(uint32 fileType, int fileSize)
1422 {
1423  int blocks=s_round_up_to_platforms_block_size(fileSize)/s_get_platforms_block_size();
1424 
1425  switch (Config::GetHardware())
1426  {
1427  case Config::HARDWARE_PS2:
1428  case Config::HARDWARE_PS2_PROVIEW:
1429  case Config::HARDWARE_PS2_DEVSYSTEM:
1430  {
1431  // Add in the icon space required
1432  blocks+=s_get_icon_k_required(fileType);
1433 
1434  // Then add in the space used up by the mem card file system.
1435  blocks+=4;
1436  break;
1437  }
1438 
1439  case Config::HARDWARE_XBOX:
1440  {
1441  // Add in the icon space required
1442  blocks+=3;
1443  break;
1444  }
1445 
1446  case Config::HARDWARE_NGC:
1447  // All done, I think.
1448  break;
1449 
1450  default:
1451  break;
1452  }
1453 
1454  return blocks;
1455 }
1456 
1457 /******************************************************************/
1458 /* */
1459 /* */
1460 /******************************************************************/
1461 
1462 // This returns the block size for mem card files.
1463 // On some platforms, using a library function to get the file size will not
1464 // return the original file size, but will return the size rounded up to the next
1465 // multiple of the block size.
1466 // In order that the calculated checksum be the same on loading, the files are always
1467 // padded with zeros to be a multiple of the block size before the checksum is calculated.
1468 static int s_get_platforms_block_size()
1469 {
1470  switch (Config::GetHardware())
1471  {
1472  case Config::HARDWARE_PS2:
1473  case Config::HARDWARE_PS2_PROVIEW:
1474  case Config::HARDWARE_PS2_DEVSYSTEM:
1475  return 1024;
1476  break;
1477 
1478  case Config::HARDWARE_NGC:
1479  return 8192;
1480  break;
1481 
1482  case Config::HARDWARE_XBOX:
1483  return 16384;
1484  break;
1485 
1486  default:
1487  break;
1488  }
1489 
1490  return 1;
1491 }
1492 
1493 /******************************************************************/
1494 /* */
1495 /* */
1496 /******************************************************************/
1497 static int s_round_up_to_platforms_block_size(int fileSize)
1498 {
1499  int block_size=s_get_platforms_block_size();
1500  if (fileSize%block_size)
1501  {
1502  return (1+fileSize/block_size)*block_size;
1503  }
1504  else
1505  {
1506  return fileSize;
1507  }
1508 }
1509

1514 static int s_get_version_number(uint32 fileType)
1515 {
1516  switch (fileType)
1517  {
1518  case 0xb010f357: // OptionsAndPros
1519  return Script::GetInt( "VERSION_OPTIONSANDPROS", Script::ASSERT );
1520  break;
1521  case 0xffc529f4: // Cas
1522  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("CAS mem card files are no longer supported! Use OptionsAndPros file type instead"));
1523  //return Script::GetInt( "VERSION_CAS", Script::ASSERT );
1524  break;
1525  case 0x61a1bc57: // Cat
1526  return Script::GetInt( "VERSION_CAT", Script::ASSERT );
1527  break;
1528  case 0x3bf882cc: // Park
1529  return Script::GetInt( "VERSION_PARK", Script::ASSERT );
1530  break;
1531  case 0x26c80b0d: // Replay
1532  return Script::GetInt( "VERSION_REPLAY", Script::ASSERT );
1533  break;
1534  case 0xca41692d: // NetworkSettings
1535  return Script::GetInt( "VERSION_NETWORKSETTINGS", Script::ASSERT );
1536  break;
1537  case 0x62896edf: // CreatedGoals
1538  return Script::GetInt( "VERSION_CREATEDGOALS", Script::ASSERT );
1539  break;
1540  default:
1541  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("Bad fileType of '%s' sent to s_get_version_number",FindChecksumName(fileType)));
1542  break;
1543  }
1544  return -1;
1545 }

1547 static const char *s_generate_xbox_directory_name(uint32 fileType, const char *p_name)
1548 {
1549  static char p_directory_name[100];
1550 
1551  switch( fileType )
1552  {
1553  case 0xca41692d: // NetworkSettings
1554  {
1555  sprintf( p_directory_name, "%s-NetworkSettings", p_name);
1556  break;
1557  }
1558  case 0xb010f357: // OptionsAndPros
1559  {
1560  sprintf( p_directory_name, "%s-Story/Skater", p_name );
1561  break;
1562  }
1563  case 0xffc529f4: // Cas
1564  {
1565  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("CAS mem card files are no longer supported! Use OptionsAndPros file type instead"));
1566  //sprintf( p_directory_name, "%s-Skater", p_name );
1567  break;
1568  }
1569  case 0x61a1bc57: // Cat
1570  {
1571  sprintf( p_directory_name, "%s-Trick", p_name );
1572  break;
1573  }
1574  case 0x3bf882cc: // Park
1575  {
1576  sprintf( p_directory_name, "%s-Park", p_name );
1577  break;
1578  }
1579  case 0x26c80b0d: // Replay
1580  {
1581  sprintf( p_directory_name, "%s-Replay", p_name );
1582  break;
1583  }
1584  case 0x62896edf: // CreatedGoals
1585  {
1586  sprintf( p_directory_name, "%s-Goals", p_name );
1587  break;
1588  }
1589  default:
1590  {
1591  Dbg_MsgAssert( 0, ( "Bad file type of '%s' for file '%s' sent to s_generate_xbox_directory_name", FindChecksumName(fileType),p_name));
1592  break;
1593  }
1594  }
1595  Dbg_MsgAssert( strlen( p_directory_name ) < 100, ( "Oops" ));
1596 
1597  return p_directory_name;
1598 }

1600 /******************************************************************/
1601 /* */
1602 /* */
1603 /******************************************************************/
1604 // Returns false if error.
1605 static bool s_make_xbox_dir_and_icons( Mc::Card *p_card,
1606  uint32 fileType, const char *p_name,
1607  char *p_card_file_name,
1608  bool *p_insufficientSpace)
1609 {
1610  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_card_file_name,("NULL p_card_file_name"));
1611  p_card_file_name[0]=0;
1612 
1613  // Generate the directory name
1614  const char *p_directory_name=s_generate_xbox_directory_name(fileType,p_name);
1615 
1616  // Create the directory
1617  if (!p_card->MakeDirectory(p_directory_name))
1618  {
1619  if (p_card->GetLastError()==Mc::Card::vINSUFFICIENT_SPACE)
1620  {
1621  *p_insufficientSpace=true;
1622  }
1623  return false;
1624  }
1625 
1626  // Calculate the low-level file name.
1627  const char *p_low_level_directory_name=p_card->ConvertDirectory(p_directory_name);
1628  if (!p_low_level_directory_name)
1629  {
1630  return false;
1631  }
1632 
1633  sprintf( p_card_file_name, "/%s/%s", p_low_level_directory_name, p_low_level_directory_name );
1634  Dbg_MsgAssert(strlen(p_card_file_name)<MAX_CARD_FILE_NAME_CHARS,("Oops"));
1635 
1636 
1637  // Write out the icon file.
1638  char pTitle[100];
1639  char* pSourceIconFile = "";
1640  char* pIcoName = "";
1641 
1642  switch (fileType)
1643  {
1644  case 0xb010f357: // OptionsAndPros
1645  {
1646  const char *p_title=Script::GetString(CRCD(0x130ab28a,"cfuncs_str_thugstoryskater"));
1647  strcpy(pTitle,p_title);
1648  strcat(pTitle,p_name);
1649  pIcoName = "saveimage.xbx";
1650  pSourceIconFile = "images\\miscellaneous\\xbox_icon_career.xbx";
1651  break;
1652  }
1653 
1654  case 0xca41692d: // NetworkSettings
1655  {
1656  const char *p_title=Script::GetString(CRCD(0x92c497ae,"cfuncs_str_thugnetsettings"));
1657  strcpy(pTitle,p_title);
1658  strcat(pTitle,p_name);
1659  pIcoName = "saveimage.xbx";
1660  // Need new icon ...
1661  pSourceIconFile = "images\\miscellaneous\\xbox_icon_career.xbx";
1662  break;
1663  }
1664 
1665  case 0x62896edf: // CreatedGoals
1666  {
1667  const char *p_title=Script::GetString(CRCD(0x257678cb,"cfuncs_str_thuggoals"));
1668  strcpy(pTitle,p_title);
1669  strcat(pTitle,p_name);
1670  pIcoName = "saveimage.xbx";
1671  // Need new icon ...
1672  pSourceIconFile = "images\\miscellaneous\\xbox_icon_goal.xbx";
1673  break;
1674  }
1675 
1676  case 0xffc529f4: // Cas
1677  {
1678  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("CAS mem card files are no longer supported! Use OptionsAndPros file type instead"));
1679  /*
1680  sprintf(pTitle,"THUG Skater:%s",p_name);
1681  pIcoName = "saveimage.xbx";
1682  pSourceIconFile = "images\\miscellaneous\\xbox_icon_skater.xbx";
1683  */
1684  break;
1685  }
1686 
1687  case 0x61a1bc57: // CAT
1688  {
1689  const char *p_title=Script::GetString(CRCD(0x3aa2cffa,"cfuncs_str_thugtrick"));
1690  strcpy(pTitle,p_title);
1691  strcat(pTitle,p_name);
1692  pIcoName = "saveimage.xbx";
1693  pSourceIconFile = "images\\miscellaneous\\xbox_icon_tricks.xbx";
1694  break;
1695  }
1696 
1697  case 0x3bf882cc: // Park
1698  {
1699  const char *p_title=Script::GetString(CRCD(0x2171fddc,"cfuncs_str_thugpark"));
1700  strcpy(pTitle,p_title);
1701  strcat(pTitle,p_name);
1702  pIcoName = "saveimage.xbx";
1703  pSourceIconFile = "images\\miscellaneous\\xbox_icon_park.xbx";
1704  break;
1705  }
1706 
1707  case 0x26c80b0d: // Replay
1708  {
1709  //sprintf(pTitle,"THUG Replay:%s",p_name);
1710  //pIcoName = "saveimage.xbx";
1711  //pSourceIconFile = "images\\miscellaneous\\xbox_icon_replay.xbx";
1712  break;
1713  }
1714 
1715  default:
1716  {
1717  Dbg_MsgAssert( 0, ( "Bad file type sent to s_make_xbox_dir_and_icons" ));
1718  break;
1719  }
1720  }
1721 
1722  // Now load the .ico file into memory
1723  uint32 FileSize = 0;
1724  char* pIco = NULL;
1725 
1726  File::StopStreaming();
1727 
1728  // Get the file interface.
1729  void *pFP = File::Open(pSourceIconFile, "rb");
1730  Dbg_MsgAssert(pFP,("No %s file found.",pSourceIconFile));
1731 
1732  FileSize = File::GetFileSize( pFP );
1733 
1734  // Allocate a buffer to hold the file.
1735  Mem::Manager::sHandle().PushContext( Mem::Manager::sHandle().TopDownHeap());
1736 
1737  // Allocating the size rounded up to a multiple of 2048 in case file reading only reads a whole number of sectors.
1738  pIco = (char*)Mem::Malloc(( FileSize + 2047 ) & ~2047 );
1739  Dbg_MsgAssert( pIco, ( "Could not allocate memory for %s", pSourceIconFile ));
1740  Mem::Manager::sHandle().PopContext();
1741 
1742  // Read the file into the buffer and close the file.
1743 #ifdef __NOPT_ASSERT__
1744  long BytesRead=
1745 #endif
1746  File::Read( pIco, 1, FileSize, pFP );
1747  Dbg_MsgAssert( (uint32)BytesRead <= FileSize, ( "Bad rwfread when loading %s", pSourceIconFile ));
1748  File::Close( pFP );
1749 
1750  bool SavedOK = false;
1751  char pFullIcoName[100];
1752  sprintf( pFullIcoName, "\\%s\\%s", p_low_level_directory_name, pIcoName );
1753  Dbg_MsgAssert( strlen( pFullIcoName ) < 100,( "Ooops" ));
1754 
1755  Mc::File* pFile = p_card->Open( pFullIcoName, Mc::File::mMODE_WRITE | Mc::File::mMODE_CREATE );
1756  if (p_card->GetLastError()==Mc::Card::vINSUFFICIENT_SPACE)
1757  {
1758  *p_insufficientSpace=true;
1759  }
1760 
1761  if( pFile )
1762  {
1763  uint32 CardBytesWritten = pFile->Write( pIco, FileSize );
1764  if (p_card->GetLastError()==Mc::Card::vINSUFFICIENT_SPACE)
1765  {
1766  *p_insufficientSpace=true;
1767  }
1768 
1769  if( CardBytesWritten == FileSize )
1770  {
1771  SavedOK = true;
1772  }
1773  if( !pFile->Flush())
1774  {
1775  SavedOK = false;
1776  }
1777  if( !pFile->Close())
1778  {
1779  SavedOK = false;
1780  }
1781  delete pFile;
1782  }
1783  Mem::Free( pIco );
1784  return SavedOK;
1785 }

1787 static void s_generate_card_directory_name(uint32 fileType, const char *p_name, char *p_card_directory_name)

1795  sprintf(p_card_directory_name,"/%s%s",p_header,p_ascii_checksum);
1796

2042

2044  Mem::Manager::sHandle().PushContext(Mem::Manager::sHandle().TopDownHeap());
2045  // Allocating the size rounded up to a multiple of 2048 in case file reading only
2046  // reads a whole number of sectors.

2048  Dbg_MsgAssert(pIco,("Could not allocate memory for %s",pSourceIconFile));
2049  Mem::Manager::sHandle().PopContext();

2052 #ifdef __NOPT_ASSERT__

2054 #endif

2056  Dbg_MsgAssert(BytesRead<=FileSize,("Bad rwfread when loading %s",pSourceIconFile));

2060  bool SavedOK=false;
2061 
2062  pFile=p_card->Open( p_icon_sys, Mc::File::mMODE_WRITE | Mc::File::mMODE_CREATE );
2063  if (p_card->GetLastError()==Mc::Card::vINSUFFICIENT_SPACE)
2064  {
2065  *p_insufficientSpace=true;
2066  }
2067

2069  {
2070  //printf("Writing %s, %d bytes\n",pIconSys,sizeof(IconSys));

2072  if (p_card->GetLastError()==Mc::Card::vINSUFFICIENT_SPACE)
2073  {
2074  *p_insufficientSpace=true;
2075  }
2076 
2077  if (CardBytesWritten==sizeof(IconSys))
2078  {
2079  SavedOK=true;
2080  }
2081 
2082  if (!pFile->Flush())
2083  {
2084  SavedOK=false;
2085  }
2086  if (!pFile->Close())
2087  {
2088  SavedOK=false;
2089  }
2090 
2091  delete pFile;
2092  }
2093 
2094  // Bail out straight away if the previous save failed so that the error code as
2095  // returned by Card::GetLastError is correct.
2096  if (!SavedOK)
2097  {
2098  Mem::Free(pIco);
2099  return false;
2100  }
2101 
2102  SavedOK=false;
2103  char pFullIcoName[MAX_CARD_FILE_NAME_CHARS+1];
2104  sprintf(pFullIcoName,"%s/%s",p_directory_name,pIcoName);
2105  Dbg_MsgAssert(strlen(pFullIcoName)<MAX_CARD_FILE_NAME_CHARS,("Ooops"));
2106 
2107  pFile=p_card->Open( pFullIcoName, Mc::File::mMODE_WRITE | Mc::File::mMODE_CREATE );
2108  if (p_card->GetLastError()==Mc::Card::vINSUFFICIENT_SPACE)
2109  {
2110  *p_insufficientSpace=true;
2111  }
2112 
2113  if (pFile)
2114  {
2115  //printf("Writing %s, %d bytes\n",pFullIcoName,FileSize);
2116  uint32 CardBytesWritten=pFile->Write( pIco, FileSize );
2117  if (p_card->GetLastError()==Mc::Card::vINSUFFICIENT_SPACE)
2118  {
2119  *p_insufficientSpace=true;
2120  }
2121 
2122  if (CardBytesWritten==FileSize)
2123  {
2124  SavedOK=true;
2125  }
2126 
2127  if (!pFile->Flush())
2128  {
2129  SavedOK=false;
2130  }
2131  if (!pFile->Close())
2132  {
2133  SavedOK=false;
2134  }
2135 
2136  delete pFile;
2137  }
2138

2140  return SavedOK;
2141 }

2157  const char *p_name)
2158 {
2159 
2160  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_fileHeader,("NULL p_fileHeader"));
2161  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_card,("NULL p_card"));

2169  switch( fileType )

2174  break;

2178  {

2207 
2208  // We used to have each of the save types in the switch statement above choose a different
2209  // name, one which contained the save type, ie "THUG: Skater"
2210  // We then had to change them to all have the same name, namely "Tony Hawk's Underground"
2211  // This is because Nintendo required that we prefix all our save names with Tony Hawk's Underground, but
2212  // when we tried to append the save type as well the text was too long for the IPL screen.
2213  strcpy((char*)p_buffer, Script::GetString(CRCD(0x6a6214bc,"cfuncs_str_ngc_generic_save_name")));

2216 
2217  // Find the index of the number character that precedes the .
2218  // This used to be set a hard wired value for each of the cases above, but changed to
2219  // calculate it instead cos the icon file names could quite likely change.
2220  int name_index=0;
2221  while (p_icon_name[name_index] && p_icon_name[name_index] != '.')
2222  {
2223  ++name_index;
2224  }
2225  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_icon_name[name_index],("No '.' found in icon name '%s'",p_icon_name));
2226  --name_index;
2227 
2228 
2229  CARDStat stat;
2230  CARDGetStatus( p_card->GetSlot(), p_file->m_file_number, &stat );
2231 
2232  // Set up to write the banner and icon data.
2233  char* next_pixel = (char*)p_buffer + 64;
2234 
2235  // Load the banner file.
2236  void *p_FH = File::Open( "icons\\thps3_bannericon_01.img.ngc", "rb" );
2237  Dbg_MsgAssert( p_FH, ( "Couldn't open texture file %s\n", "icons\\thps3_bannericon_01.img.ngc" ) );
2238 
2239  int dummy;
2240  int width;
2241  int height;
2242  // Read header info.
2243  File::Read( &dummy, sizeof( int ), 1, p_FH ); // version
2244  File::Read( &dummy, sizeof( int ), 1, p_FH ); // checksum
2245  File::Read( &width, sizeof( int ), 1, p_FH );
2246  File::Read( &height, sizeof( int ), 1, p_FH );
2247  File::Read( &dummy, sizeof( int ), 1, p_FH ); // depth
2248  File::Read( &dummy, sizeof( int ), 1, p_FH ); // levels
2249  File::Read( &dummy, sizeof( int ), 1, p_FH ); // rwidth
2250  File::Read( &dummy, sizeof( int ), 1, p_FH ); // rheight
2251  File::Read( &dummy, sizeof( int ), 1, p_FH ); // has_holes/alphamap
2252 
2253  Dbg_MsgAssert( width == 96, ( "Bad mem card banner width" ));
2254  Dbg_MsgAssert( height == 32, ( "Bad mem card banner height" ));
2255 
2256  // Read image & palette data.
2257  File::Read( next_pixel, 96 * 32, 1, p_FH );
2258  next_pixel += ( 96 * 32 );
2259  File::Read( next_pixel, 256 * 2, 1, p_FH );
2260  next_pixel += ( 256 * 2 );
2261 
2262  File::Close( p_FH );
2263 
2264 # if 0
2265  // Write out a dummy array representing the banner image.
2266  OSReport( "unsigned short image[96*32] = {\n" );
2267  for( int i = 0; i < 32; ++i )

2278  // Load the icon files.
2279  for( int i = 0; i < 7; ++i )
2280  {
2281  p_icon_name[name_index] = '1' + i;
2282 
2283  // Load the icon file.

2286

2300

2302  Dbg_MsgAssert( height == 32, ( "Bad mem card banner height" ));
2303 
2304  // Read image & palette data.
2305  File::Read( next_pixel, 32 * 32, 1, p_FH );
2306  next_pixel += ( 32 * 32 );
2307  if( i == 6 )
2308  {
2309  File::Read( next_pixel, 256 * 2, 1, p_FH );
2310  next_pixel += 256*2;
2311  }
2312 
2313  File::Close( p_FH );
2314 
2315  // Icon formats.
2316  CARDSetIconFormat( &stat, i, CARD_STAT_ICON_C8 );
2317 
2318  // Anim speeds.
2319  CARDSetIconSpeed( &stat, i, CARD_STAT_SPEED_MIDDLE );
2320  }
2321 
2322  Dbg_MsgAssert(next_pixel==(char*)p_buffer+NGC_MEMCARD_ICON_DATA_SIZE,("Incorrect NGC_MEMCARD_ICON_DATA_SIZE, too big by %d bytes",NGC_MEMCARD_ICON_DATA_SIZE-(next_pixel-(char*)p_buffer)));
2323  stat.commentAddr = (uint32)p_fileHeader->mpIconData-(uint32)p_fileHeader;
2324  stat.iconAddr = stat.commentAddr + 64; // End of comment strings.
2325 
2326  // Banner format.
2327  CARDSetBannerFormat( &stat, CARD_STAT_BANNER_C8 );
2328  CARDSetIconSpeed( &stat, 7, CARD_STAT_SPEED_END );
2329  CARDSetIconAnim( &stat, CARD_STAT_ANIM_LOOP );
2330  CARDSetStatus( p_card->GetSlot(), p_file->m_file_number, &stat );
2331  return true;
2332 }
2333 #else
2334 static bool s_insert_ngc_icon( SMcFileHeader *p_fileHeader,
2335  Mc::Card *p_card,
2336  Mc::File *p_file,
2337  uint32 fileType,
2338  const char *p_name)
2339 {
2340  return false;
2341 }
2342 #endif // #ifdef __PLAT_NGC__
2343 
2344 static bool s_first_date_is_more_recent(Script::CStruct *p_a, Script::CStruct *p_b)
2345 {
2346  int year_a=0;
2347  int month_a=0;
2348  int day_a=0;
2349  int hour_a=0;
2350  int minutes_a=0;
2351  int seconds_a=0;
2352 
2353  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_a,("NULL p_a"));
2354  p_a->GetInteger(CRCD(0x447d8cc8,"Year"),&year_a);
2355  p_a->GetInteger(CRCD(0x7149eff9,"Month"),&month_a);
2356  p_a->GetInteger(CRCD(0x1a5fd66f,"Day"),&day_a);
2357  p_a->GetInteger(CRCD(0x8fe1eeb1,"Hour"),&hour_a);
2358  p_a->GetInteger(CRCD(0x5f94b55c,"Minutes"),&minutes_a);
2359  p_a->GetInteger(CRCD(0xd029f619,"Seconds"),&seconds_a);
2360 
2361  int year_b=0;
2362  int month_b=0;
2363  int day_b=0;
2364  int hour_b=0;
2365  int minutes_b=0;
2366  int seconds_b=0;
2367 
2368  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_b,("NULL p_b"));
2369  p_b->GetInteger(CRCD(0x447d8cc8,"Year"),&year_b);
2370  p_b->GetInteger(CRCD(0x7149eff9,"Month"),&month_b);
2371  p_b->GetInteger(CRCD(0x1a5fd66f,"Day"),&day_b);
2372  p_b->GetInteger(CRCD(0x8fe1eeb1,"Hour"),&hour_b);
2373  p_b->GetInteger(CRCD(0x5f94b55c,"Minutes"),&minutes_b);
2374  p_b->GetInteger(CRCD(0xd029f619,"Seconds"),&seconds_b);
2375 
2376  bool more_recent=false;
2377 
2378  if (year_a < year_b)
2379  {
2380  }
2381  else if (year_a > year_b)
2382  {
2383  more_recent=true;
2384  }
2385  else if (month_a < month_b)
2386  {
2387  }
2388  else if (month_a > month_b)
2389  {
2390  more_recent=true;
2391  }
2392  else if (day_a < day_b)
2393  {
2394  }
2395  else if (day_a > day_b)
2396  {
2397  more_recent=true;
2398  }
2399  else if (hour_a < hour_b)
2400  {
2401  }
2402  else if (hour_a > hour_b)
2403  {
2404  more_recent=true;
2405  }
2406  else if (minutes_a < minutes_b)
2407  {
2408  }
2409  else if (minutes_a > minutes_b)
2410  {
2411  more_recent=true;
2412  }
2413  else if (seconds_a < seconds_b)
2414  {
2415  }
2416  else if (seconds_a > seconds_b)
2417  {
2418  more_recent=true;
2419  }
2420  else
2421  {
2422  // Exactly the same date/time, so call it more recent.
2423  more_recent=true;
2424  }
2425 
2426  return more_recent;
2427 }

2434 // @script | GetMostRecentSave | Finds the most recent save of the given type in the passed
2435 // directory listing. Puts the result into a structure called MostRecentSave. Any existing
2436 // parameter called MostRecentSave will be removed first. If there are no files, no MostRecentSave
2437 // parameter will be created.
2438 // @uparmopt [] | The directory listing. Must be an array of structures.
2439 // @uparmopt name | The save type. If omitted it will return the most recent save of any type.
2440 bool ScriptGetMostRecentSave(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
2441 {
2442  pScript->GetParams()->RemoveComponent("MostRecentSave");
2443 
2444  CArray *p_array=NULL;
2445  pParams->GetArray(NONAME,&p_array);
2446 
2447  if (!p_array)
2448  {
2449  return false;
2450  }
2451 
2452  uint32 file_type=0;
2453  pParams->GetChecksum(NONAME,&file_type);
2454 
2455  CStruct *p_most_recent=NULL;
2456  for (uint32 i=0; i<p_array->GetSize(); ++i)
2457  {
2458  CStruct *p_struct=p_array->GetStructure(i);
2459 
2460  uint32 this_file_type=0;
2461  p_struct->GetChecksum("file_type",&this_file_type);
2462 
2463  if (file_type && file_type!=this_file_type)
2464  {
2465  continue;
2466  }
2467 
2468  if (p_struct->ContainsFlag("BadVersion") ||
2469  p_struct->ContainsFlag("Corrupt"))
2470  {
2471  if (Config::GetHardware() == Config::HARDWARE_XBOX ||
2472  Config::GetHardware() == Config::HARDWARE_NGC)
2473  {
2474  // For the XBox, do not ignore bad files, so that an error message will appear on bootup
2475  // if the most recent save is bad. (TT6236)
2476  // Same for NGC (TT13519)
2477  }
2478  else
2479  {
2480  // For other platforms, find the most recent good save.
2481  continue;
2482  }
2483  }
2484 
2485  if (p_most_recent)
2486  {
2487  if (s_first_date_is_more_recent(p_struct, p_most_recent))
2488  {
2489  p_most_recent=p_struct;
2490  }
2491  }
2492  else
2493  {
2494  p_most_recent=p_struct;
2495  }
2496  }
2497 
2498  if (p_most_recent)
2499  {
2500  pScript->GetParams()->AddStructure("MostRecentSave",p_most_recent);
2501  return true;
2502  }
2503 
2504  return false;
2505 }

2512 // @script | GetMemCardSpaceAvailable | Puts the amount of space left on the mem card
2513 // into the parameter SpaceAvailable. Units are K for the PS2
2514 bool ScriptGetMemCardSpaceAvailable(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
2515 {
2516  pScript->GetParams()->AddInteger(CRCD(0xc37c363,"SpaceAvailable"),0);
2517  pScript->GetParams()->AddInteger(CRCD(0x855b2fc,"FilesLeft"),1000000);
2518 
2519  Mc::Manager * mc_man = Mc::Manager::Instance();
2520  Mc::Card* p_card=mc_man->GetCard(0,0);
2521  if (p_card)
2522  {
2523  pScript->GetParams()->AddInteger(CRCD(0xc37c363,"SpaceAvailable"),p_card->GetNumFreeClusters());
2524  #ifdef __PLAT_NGC__
2525  pScript->GetParams()->AddInteger(CRCD(0x855b2fc,"FilesLeft"),p_card->CountFilesLeft());
2526  #endif
2527 
2528  return true;
2529  }
2530 
2531  return false;
2532 }

2539 // @script | GetMemCardSpaceRequired | Calculates the amount of space required to save the specified
2540 // file type to the memory card, and puts it into the parameter SpaceRequired.

2560 // @script | MemCardFileExists | returns true if the file already exists
2561 // on the card
2562 // @parm string | Name | the name of the file
2563 // @parm name | type | the type of the file
2564 bool ScriptMemCardFileExists(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
2565 {
2566  Mc::Manager * mc_man = Mc::Manager::Instance();
2567  Mc::Card* p_card=mc_man->GetCard(0,0);
2568  if (!p_card)
2569  {
2570  return false;
2571  }
2572 
2573  const char *p_name=NULL;
2574  pParams->GetText("Name",&p_name);
2575 
2576  uint32 file_type=0;
2577  pParams->GetChecksum("Type",&file_type);
2578 
2579  if (!p_name || !file_type)
2580  {
2581  return false;
2582  }
2583 
2584  char p_card_file_name[MAX_CARD_FILE_NAME_CHARS+1];
2585  p_card_file_name[0]=0;
2586 
2587  const char *p_xbox_directory_name=NULL;
2588  const char *p_xbox_converted_directory_name=NULL;
2589 
2590  switch (Config::GetHardware())
2591  {
2592  case Config::HARDWARE_XBOX:
2593  {
2594  p_xbox_directory_name=s_generate_xbox_directory_name(file_type,p_name);
2595  p_xbox_converted_directory_name=p_card->ConvertDirectory(p_xbox_directory_name);
2596  if (!p_xbox_converted_directory_name)
2597  {
2598  return false;
2599  }
2600  sprintf(p_card_file_name,"/%s/%s",p_xbox_converted_directory_name,p_xbox_converted_directory_name);
2601  Dbg_MsgAssert(strlen(p_card_file_name)<MAX_CARD_FILE_NAME_CHARS,("Oops"));
2602  break;
2603  }
2604 
2605  case Config::HARDWARE_PS2:
2606  case Config::HARDWARE_PS2_PROVIEW:
2607  case Config::HARDWARE_PS2_DEVSYSTEM:
2608  case Config::HARDWARE_NGC:
2609  {
2610  const char *p_header=Config::GetMemCardHeader();
2611  char p_ascii_checksum[20];
2612  s_generate_ascii_checksum(p_ascii_checksum,p_name,file_type);
2613 
2614  sprintf(p_card_file_name,"/%s%s/%s%s", p_header,p_ascii_checksum,
2615  p_header,p_ascii_checksum);
2616  Dbg_MsgAssert(strlen(p_card_file_name)<MAX_CARD_FILE_NAME_CHARS,("Oops"));
2617  break;
2618  }
2619 
2620  default:
2621  break;
2622  }
2623 
2624  Mc::File* pFile = p_card->Open( p_card_file_name, Mc::File::mMODE_READ );
2625  if (pFile)
2626  {
2627  int file_size=pFile->Seek(0,Mc::File::BASE_END);
2628  int total_size_on_card=s_calculate_total_space_used_on_card(file_type,file_size);
2629  pScript->GetParams()->AddInteger("total_file_size",total_size_on_card);
2630 
2631  pFile->Flush();
2632  pFile->Close();
2633  delete pFile;
2634  return true;
2635  }
2636 
2637  if (Config::GetHardware()==Config::HARDWARE_XBOX)
2638  {
2639  // Better delete the directory we just created ...
2640  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_xbox_directory_name,("NULL p_xbox_directory_name ?"));
2641  p_card->DeleteDirectory(p_xbox_directory_name);
2642  }
2643  return false;
2644 }

2647 /* */
2648 /* */
2649 /******************************************************************/
2650 
2651 // @script | DeleteMemCardFile | Deletes the specified file from the memory card
2652 // @parmopt string | CardFileName | | The name of the file as stored on the memory card. If this is
2653 // not specified then it is derived from UserFileName and Type
2654 // @parmopt string | UserFileName | | The name of the file as it appears in the files menu
2655 // @parm name | Type | The file type (NetworkSettings, OptionsAndPros, Cas, Park, Replay)
2656 
2657 bool ScriptDeleteMemCardFile(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
2658 {
2659  if ( Config::GetHardware() != Config::HARDWARE_XBOX)
2660  {
2661  Pcm::PauseMusic(true);
2662  Pcm::PauseStream(true);
2663  }
2664 
2665  Mc::Manager * mc_man = Mc::Manager::Instance();
2666  Mc::Card* p_card=mc_man->GetCard(0,0);
2667  if (!p_card)
2668  {
2669  if ( Config::GetHardware() != Config::HARDWARE_XBOX)
2670  {
2671  Pcm::PauseMusic( -1 );
2672  Pcm::PauseStream( -1 );
2673  }
2674  return false;
2675  }
2676 
2677  bool delete_succeeded=true;
2678 
2679  const char *p_xbox_directory_name=NULL;
2680  pParams->GetString("XBoxDirectoryName",&p_xbox_directory_name);
2681  const char *p_full_file_name=NULL;
2682  pParams->GetString("CardFileName",&p_full_file_name);
2683  uint32 file_type=0;
2684  pParams->GetChecksum("Type",&file_type);
2685  const char *p_name="";
2686  pParams->GetString("UserFileName",&p_name);
2687 
2688 
2689  switch (Config::GetHardware())
2690  {
2691  case Config::HARDWARE_NGC:
2692  {
2693  if (p_full_file_name)
2694  {
2695  if (!p_card->Delete(p_full_file_name))
2696  {
2697  delete_succeeded=false;
2698  }
2699  }
2700  else
2701  {
2702  char p_temp[MAX_CARD_FILE_NAME_CHARS+1];
2703 
2704  // If p_full_file_name is not specified then derive it from Type and UserFileName
2705 
2706  const char *p_header=Config::GetMemCardHeader();
2707  char p_ascii_checksum[20];
2708  s_generate_ascii_checksum(p_ascii_checksum,p_name,file_type);
2709 
2710  sprintf(p_temp,"%s%s%s%s",p_header,p_ascii_checksum,
2711  p_header,p_ascii_checksum);
2712  Dbg_MsgAssert(strlen(p_temp)<MAX_CARD_FILE_NAME_CHARS,("Oops"));
2713 
2714  if (!p_card->Delete(p_temp))
2715  {
2716  delete_succeeded=false;
2717  }
2718  }
2719  break;
2720  }
2721 
2722  case Config::HARDWARE_XBOX:
2723  {
2724  if (!p_xbox_directory_name)
2725  {
2726  // Derive p_xbox_directory_name from the file type and user file name
2727  p_xbox_directory_name=s_generate_xbox_directory_name(file_type,p_name);
2728 
2729  }
2730  if (!p_card->DeleteDirectory( p_xbox_directory_name ))
2731  {
2732  delete_succeeded=false;
2733  }
2734  break;
2735  }
2736 
2737  case Config::HARDWARE_PS2:
2738  case Config::HARDWARE_PS2_PROVIEW:
2739  case Config::HARDWARE_PS2_DEVSYSTEM:
2740  {
2741  char p_temp[MAX_CARD_FILE_NAME_CHARS+1];
2742 
2743  if (!p_full_file_name)
2744  {
2745  // If p_full_file_name is not specified then derive it from Type and UserFileName
2746 
2747  const char *p_header=Config::GetMemCardHeader();
2748  char p_ascii_checksum[20];
2749  s_generate_ascii_checksum(p_ascii_checksum,p_name,file_type);
2750 
2751  sprintf(p_temp,"/%s%s/%s%s",p_header,p_ascii_checksum,
2752  p_header,p_ascii_checksum);
2753  Dbg_MsgAssert(strlen(p_temp)<MAX_CARD_FILE_NAME_CHARS,("Oops"));
2754 
2755  p_full_file_name=p_temp;
2756  }
2757 
2758  int len=strlen(p_full_file_name);
2759  uint32 file_type=s_determine_file_type(p_full_file_name[len-1]);
2760 
2761  // Generate the directory name.
2762  Dbg_MsgAssert(len<100,("File name too long"));
2763  char p_directory_name[100];
2764  char *p_dest=p_directory_name;
2765  const char *p_source=p_full_file_name;
2766  // Copy the first '/'
2767  *p_dest++=*p_source++;
2768  while (*p_source && *p_source!='/')
2769  {
2770  *p_dest++=*p_source++;
2771  }
2772  *p_dest=0;
2773 
2774  // Delete the file that has the same name as the directory
2775  if (!p_card->Delete(p_full_file_name))
2776  {
2777  delete_succeeded=false;
2778  }
2779 
2780  // Delete the icon.sys file
2781  char p_buf[100];
2782  sprintf(p_buf,"%s/icon.sys",p_directory_name);
2783  Dbg_MsgAssert(strlen(p_buf)<100,("Oops"));
2784  if (!p_card->Delete(p_buf))
2785  {
2786  delete_succeeded=false;
2787  }
2788 
2789  // Delete the .ico file.
2790  switch (file_type)
2791  {
2792  case 0xffc529f4: // Cas
2793  {
2794  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("CAS mem card files are no longer supported! Use OptionsAndPros file type instead"));
2795  //sprintf(p_buf,"%s/cas.ico",p_directory_name);
2796  break;
2797  }
2798 
2799  case 0x61a1bc57: // CAT
2800  {
2801  sprintf(p_buf,"%s/tricks.ico",p_directory_name);
2802  break;
2803  }
2804 
2805  case 0x3bf882cc: // Park
2806  {
2807  sprintf(p_buf,"%s/parked.ico",p_directory_name);
2808  break;
2809  }
2810 
2811  case 0x26c80b0d: // Replay
2812  {
2813  sprintf(p_buf,"%s/replay.ico",p_directory_name);
2814  break;
2815  }
2816 
2817  case 0xb010f357: // OptionsAndPros
2818  {
2819  sprintf(p_buf,"%s/thps5.ico",p_directory_name);
2820  break;
2821  }
2822 
2823  case 0x62896edf: // CreatedGoals
2824  {
2825  sprintf(p_buf,"%s/goals.ico",p_directory_name);
2826  break;
2827  }
2828 
2829  case 0xca41692d: // NetworkSettings
2830  {
2831  // TODO: Change this once got a new icon file for the net settings
2832  sprintf(p_buf,"%s/network.ico",p_directory_name);
2833  break;
2834  }
2835 
2836  default:
2837  {
2838  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("Bad file type sent to DeleteMemCardFile"));
2839  break;
2840  }
2841  }
2842  Dbg_MsgAssert(strlen(p_buf)<100,("Oops"));
2843  if (!p_card->Delete(p_buf))
2844  {
2845  delete_succeeded=false;
2846  }
2847 
2848  // Delete the directory
2849  if (!p_card->DeleteDirectory(p_directory_name))
2850  {
2851  delete_succeeded=false;
2852  }
2853  break;
2854  }
2855  default:
2856  {
2857  delete_succeeded=false;
2858  break;
2859  }
2860  }
2861 
2862  if ( Config::GetHardware() != Config::HARDWARE_XBOX)
2863  {
2864  Pcm::PauseMusic( -1 );
2865  Pcm::PauseStream( -1 );
2866  }
2867 
2868  return delete_succeeded;
2869 }

2889

2900 // @script | CardIsInSlot | returns true if the memory card is in the slot
2901 bool ScriptCardIsInSlot(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
2902 {
2903 
2904  Mc::Manager * mc_man = Mc::Manager::Instance();
2905  Mc::Card* p_card=mc_man->GetCard(0,0);
2906  if (p_card)
2907  {
2908  return true;
2909  }
2910  else
2911  {
2912  #ifdef __PLAT_NGC__
2913  // On the NGC, p_card will also be NULL if the card is in the slot, but is broken.
2914  if (mc_man->GotFatalError())
2915  {
2916  return true;
2917  }
2918 
2919  // On the NGC, p_card will also be NULL if something is in the slot,
2920  // but gives a 'wrong device' error
2921  if (mc_man->GotWrongDevice())
2922  {
2923  return true;
2924  }
2925  #endif
2926  return false;
2927  }
2928 }

2967 // @script | GetSummaryInfo |
2968 bool ScriptGetSummaryInfo(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
2969 {
2970  uint32 file_type=0;
2971  pParams->GetChecksum(NONAME,&file_type);
2972 
2973  int use_vault_data=0;
2974  pParams->GetInteger(CRCD(0xc78dabf6,"VaultData"),&use_vault_data);
2975 
2976  if (use_vault_data)
2977  {
2978  file_type=sVaultDataType;
2979  Dbg_MsgAssert(spVaultData,("Called GetSummaryInfo on the vault data when there was no vault data"));
2980  s_generate_summary_info(pScript->GetParams(), file_type, spVaultData);
2981  }
2982  else
2983  {
2984  if (file_type==0xb010f357) // OptionsAndPros
2985  {
2986  // Force the goal manager to refresh the goal manager params structure.
2987  // Note that this cannot be done inside s_generate_summary_info, because LevelUnload()
2988  // will create a structure and store a pointer to it.
2989  // In other places SSwitchToNextPool() will be called before calling s_generate_summary_info,
2990  // and we don't want the structure created by LevelUnload() to come off the special memcard pool.
2991  Game::CGoalManager* p_goal_manager=Game::GetGoalManager();
2992  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_goal_manager,("NULL p_goal_manager"));
2993  p_goal_manager->LevelUnload();
2994  }
2995 
2996  s_generate_summary_info(pScript->GetParams(), file_type, NULL);
2997  }
2998 
2999  return true;
3000 }

3002 #if __USE_REPLAYS__
3003 static int sGetReplayDataSize(int num_dummies)
3004 {
3005  return sizeof(Replay::SReplayDataHeader)+
3006  num_dummies*sizeof(Replay::SSavedDummy)+
3007  Replay::GetBufferSize()+
3008  4; // The checksum of that lot
3009 }
3010 #endif
