3012 static uint32 sGetFixedFileSize(uint32 fileType)
3013 {
3014  uint32 fixed_size=0;
3015 
3016  switch (fileType)
3017  {
3018  case 0xb010f357: // OptionsAndPros
3019  fixed_size=Script::GetInteger(CRCD(0xe7f51ffe,"SaveSize_OptionsAndPros"),Script::ASSERT);
3020  break;
3021  case 0xffc529f4: // Cas
3022  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("CAS mem card files are no longer supported! Use OptionsAndPros file type instead"));
3023  //fixed_size=Script::GetInteger("SaveSize_Cas",Script::ASSERT);
3024  break;
3025  case 0x61a1bc57: // Cat
3026  fixed_size=Script::GetInteger(CRCD(0x9eecdec9,"SaveSize_Cat"),Script::ASSERT);
3027  break;
3028  case 0x62896edf: // CreatedGoals
3029  fixed_size=Script::GetInteger(CRCD(0x3308efc0,"SaveSize_CreatedGoals"),Script::ASSERT);
3030  break;
3031  case 0x3bf882cc: // Park
3032  fixed_size=Script::GetInteger(CRCD(0x2cb071ed,"SaveSize_Park"),Script::ASSERT);
3033  break;
3034  case 0x26c80b0d: // Replay
3035  fixed_size=Script::GetInteger(CRCD(0x8ee3aa00,"SaveSize_Replay"),Script::ASSERT);
3036  break;
3037  case 0xca41692d: // NetworkSettings
3038  fixed_size=Script::GetInteger(CRCD(0x651c978d,"SaveSize_NetworkSettings"),Script::ASSERT);
3039  break;
3040  default:
3041  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("Bad file_type of %s",Script::FindChecksumName(fileType)));
3042  break;
3043  }
3044  fixed_size+=sizeof(SMcFileHeader);
3045  fixed_size=s_round_up_to_platforms_block_size(fixed_size);
3046  return fixed_size;
3047 }

3054 // @script | SaveToMemoryCard |
3055 bool ScriptSaveToMemoryCard(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
3056 {
3057  if (Config::GetHardware() == Config::HARDWARE_NGC)
3058  {
3059  // On the GameCube, the temp mem card pools only exist for the duration of this function,
3060  // because they use space normally used for rendering, hence cannot exist during the mem card scripts
3061  // which may execute over many frames.
3062  ScriptCreateTemporaryMemCardPools(NULL,NULL);
3063  }
3064 
3065  if ( Config::GetHardware() != Config::HARDWARE_XBOX)
3066  {
3067  Pcm::PauseMusic(true);
3068  Pcm::PauseStream(true);
3069  }
3070 
3071  s_insufficient_space=false;
3072 
3073  const char *p_name="";
3074  pParams->GetText("Name",&p_name);
3075 
3076  uint32 file_type=0;
3077  pParams->GetChecksum("Type",&file_type);
3078 
3079  // If the SaveVaultData flag is set, it will save the stored spVaultData, which
3080  // will have been loaded from the online vault.
3081  int save_vault_data=0;
3082  pParams->GetInteger(CRCD(0xbb609e73,"SaveVaultData"),&save_vault_data);
3083  if (save_vault_data)
3084  {
3085  Dbg_MsgAssert(spVaultData,("Called SaveToMemoryCard with no vault data"));
3086  file_type=sVaultDataType;
3087  }
3088 
3089 
3090  if (!save_vault_data && file_type==0xb010f357) // OptionsAndPros
3091  {
3092  // Force the goal manager to refresh the goal manager params structure.
3093  // This has to be done before calling SSwitchToNextPool(), because LevelUnload()
3094  // will create a structure and store a pointer to it.
3095  // It is best for the special pools to be kept empty outside of GetMemCardSpaceRequired
3096  // or SaveToMemoryCard, otherwise saving the game could run out of pool space.
3097  Game::CGoalManager* p_goal_manager=Game::GetGoalManager();
3098  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_goal_manager,("NULL p_goal_manager"));
3099  p_goal_manager->LevelUnload();
3100  }
3101 
3102 
3103  // If the special pools exist, switch to them so that the components & structs etc get allocated off them.
3104  // The special pools use the space freed by unloading the skater anims, and are for preventing memory
3105  // overflows when the save size gets large.
3106  Dbg_MsgAssert(CComponent::SGetCurrentPoolIndex()==0,("Bad current CComponent pool"));
3107  Dbg_MsgAssert(CStruct::SGetCurrentPoolIndex()==0,("Bad current CStruct pool"));
3108  Dbg_MsgAssert(CVector::SGetCurrentPoolIndex()==0,("Bad current CVector pool"));
3109  bool got_special_pools=false;
3110  CComponent::SSwitchToNextPool();
3111  if (CComponent::SPoolExists())
3112  {
3113  CStruct::SSwitchToNextPool();
3114  Dbg_MsgAssert(CStruct::SPoolExists(),("No special CStruct pool ?"));
3115  CVector::SSwitchToNextPool();
3116  Dbg_MsgAssert(CVector::SPoolExists(),("No special CVector pool ?"));
3117 
3118  got_special_pools=true;
3119  }
3120  else
3121  {
3122  CComponent::SSwitchToPreviousPool();
3123  }
3124 
3125 
3126  #ifdef __NOPT_ASSERT__
3127  int initial_ccomponent_num_used_items=CComponent::SGetNumUsedItems();
3128  int initial_cstruct_num_used_items=CStruct::SGetNumUsedItems();
3129  int initial_cvector_num_used_items=CVector::SGetNumUsedItems();
3130  #endif
3131 
3132  // WARNING ! WARNING ! WARNING ! WARNING ! WARNING !
3133  // Between here and SSwitchToPreviousPool(), all CStruct's and CComponent's will be allocated
3134  // off a special pool.
3135  // This is to avoid overflowing the regular pools with these temporary big structures.
3136  // Make sure that no function, or function that it calls, stores any pointers to new CStructs
3137  // between here and SSwitchToPreviousPool().
3138  // This is just to keep the special pool clean. Things will get confusing if other stuff
3139  // gets allocated off it and uses up space there, cos then saving to mem card could start
3140  // running out of pool again.
3141 
3142  Script::CStruct *pMemCardStuff=new Script::CStruct;
3143  if (save_vault_data)
3144  {
3145  pMemCardStuff->AppendStructure(spVaultData);
3146  }
3147  else
3148  {
3149  s_insert_game_save_info(file_type,pMemCardStuff);
3150  }
3151  //Script::PrintContents(pMemCardStuff);
3152 
3153  Script::CStruct *pSummaryInfo=new Script::CStruct;
3154  s_generate_summary_info(pSummaryInfo,file_type,pMemCardStuff);
3155 
3156  // Put the user filename into the summary info too.
3157  pSummaryInfo->AddString("filename",p_name);
3158 
3159  #ifdef __NOPT_ASSERT__
3160  printf("Save type = '%s'\n",Script::FindChecksumName(file_type));
3161  printf("Num CComponents used by save = %d\n",CComponent::SGetNumUsedItems()-initial_ccomponent_num_used_items);
3162  printf("Num CStructs used by game save = %d\n",CStruct::SGetNumUsedItems()-initial_cstruct_num_used_items);
3163  printf("Num CVectors used by game save = %d\n",CVector::SGetNumUsedItems()-initial_cvector_num_used_items);
3164  #endif
3165 
3166 
3167  Mc::File* pFile=NULL;
3168  uint8 *pTemp=NULL;
3169  uint8 *p_pad=NULL;
3170  uint32 pad_size=0;
3171  bool SavedOK=false;
3172 
3173  uint32 CardBytesWritten=0;
3174  uint8 *p_dest=NULL;
3175  SMcFileHeader *p_file_header=NULL;
3176  uint32 BytesWritten=0;
3177 
3178  Mc::Manager * mc_man=NULL;
3179  Mc::Card* p_card=NULL;
3180 
3181  // fixed_size is the hard-wired file size as defined in memcard.q, rounded up to
3182  // the platform's block size. A file of exactly this size will be opened for writing.
3183  // The code will assert if the required space is greater than this.
3184  // The file sizes are required to be fixed as a TRC thing for GameCube.
3185  uint32 fixed_size=sGetFixedFileSize(file_type);
3186 
3187  // header_and_structures_size is the exact space used by the header, summary info, and
3188  // game save info structures. It is not rounded up to the platform's block size.
3189  // For all save types except replays, this comprises all the info in the file.
3190  // Replay's have the replay data tagged on the end of the file instead, because there
3191  // is not enough memory to keep it in the structures.
3192  uint32 header_and_structures_size=0;
3193 
3194 
3195  // This is the size of the replay data, if any. Not rounded up to the platform's block size.
3196  uint32 replay_data_size=0;
3197 
3198 #if __USE_REPLAYS__
3199  // The big replay data has to be tagged on the end rather than being put inside pMemCardStuff
3200  // since there is not enough memory to make a copy of the replay data there.
3201  Replay::SReplayDataHeader replay_data_header;
3202  if (file_type==0x26c80b0d/* Replay */)
3203  {
3204  Replay::WriteReplayDataHeader(&replay_data_header);
3205  replay_data_size=sGetReplayDataSize(replay_data_header.mNumStartStateDummies);
3206  }
3207 #endif
3208 
3210  //pMemCardStuff->PrintContents();
3211  //printf("Space required = %d\n",pMemCardStuff->CalculateBufferSize());
3213 
3214  // Get how much space is needed to store the structures.
3215  // Calculating this before opening the file so that if CalculateBufferSize fails,
3216  // the file won't be left with zero size, erasing the previous save game.
3217  // Passing fixed_size as the size of the temp buffer used when calculating the actual size needed.
3218  uint32 structure_size=CalculateBufferSize(pMemCardStuff, fixed_size);
3219  uint32 summary_info_size=CalculateBufferSize(pSummaryInfo,MAX_SUMMARY_INFO_SIZE);
3220  Dbg_MsgAssert(summary_info_size<=MAX_SUMMARY_INFO_SIZE,("summary_info_size too big !!"));
3221  header_and_structures_size=sizeof(SMcFileHeader)+summary_info_size+structure_size;
3222 
3223  uint32 required_size=header_and_structures_size+replay_data_size;
3224 
3225  #ifdef __NOPT_ASSERT__
3226  Dbg_MsgAssert(required_size <= fixed_size,("Need to update fixed file size for type '%s'\nMin required size = %d",Script::FindChecksumName(file_type),required_size));
3227  printf("required_size=%d, fixed_size=%d, %d percent\n",required_size,fixed_size,(100*required_size)/fixed_size);
3228  if (required_size > fixed_size)
3229  {
3230  goto ERROR;
3231  }
3232  #endif
3233 
3234  pad_size=fixed_size-required_size;
3235  if (pad_size && Config::GetHardware() != Config::HARDWARE_NGC)
3236  {
3237  p_pad=(uint8*)Mem::Malloc(pad_size);
3238  for (uint32 i=0; i<pad_size; ++i)
3239  {
3240  p_pad[i]=0x69;
3241  }
3242  }
3243 
3244  mc_man = Mc::Manager::Instance();
3245  p_card=mc_man->GetCard(0,0);
3246  if (!p_card)
3247  {
3248  goto ERROR;
3249  }
3250  // GameCube often crashes if try to do card operations on a bad card, so do this check first.
3251  if (!p_card->IsFormatted())
3252  {
3253  goto ERROR;
3254  }
3255 
3256  char p_card_file_name[MAX_CARD_FILE_NAME_CHARS+1];
3257  switch (Config::GetHardware())
3258  {
3259  case Config::HARDWARE_PS2:
3260  case Config::HARDWARE_PS2_PROVIEW:
3261  case Config::HARDWARE_PS2_DEVSYSTEM:
3262  if (!s_make_ps2_dir_and_icons(p_card,
3263  file_type,p_name,
3264  p_card_file_name,
3265  &s_insufficient_space))
3266  {
3267  goto ERROR;
3268  }
3269  break;
3270 
3271  case Config::HARDWARE_NGC:
3272  {
3273  // On the NGC, just generate the card file name.
3274  // The icon cannot be created at this point because on the NGC the
3275  // icon images have to be stored in the file data itself, so we have to
3276  // wait until after the file is opened.
3277  char p_directory_name[MAX_CARD_FILE_NAME_CHARS+1];
3278  s_generate_card_directory_name(file_type,p_name,p_directory_name);
3279 
3280  sprintf(p_card_file_name,"%s%s",p_directory_name,p_directory_name);
3281  Dbg_MsgAssert(strlen(p_card_file_name)<MAX_CARD_FILE_NAME_CHARS+1,("Oops"));
3282  break;
3283  }
3284 
3285  case Config::HARDWARE_XBOX:
3286  if (!s_make_xbox_dir_and_icons(p_card,
3287  file_type,p_name,
3288  p_card_file_name,
3289  &s_insufficient_space))
3290  {
3291  goto ERROR;
3292  }
3293  break;
3294  default:
3295  {
3296  goto ERROR;
3297  }
3298  break;
3299  }
3300 
3301 
3302  // Open a file big enough to hold all the data.
3303  //printf("Opening file %s of size %d for writing\n",p_card_file_name,fixed_size);
3304  pFile=p_card->Open( p_card_file_name, Mc::File::mMODE_WRITE | Mc::File::mMODE_CREATE, fixed_size );
3305  s_insufficient_space=p_card->GetLastError()==Mc::Card::vINSUFFICIENT_SPACE;
3306 
3307  if (!pFile)
3308  {
3309  goto ERROR;
3310  }
3311 
3312  pTemp=(uint8*)Mem::Malloc(header_and_structures_size);
3313 
3314  p_file_header=(SMcFileHeader*)pTemp;
3315  // Zero the whole structure to ensure that the XBox mSignature member is zeroed since
3316  // it will be part of the data who's signature is calculated.
3317  p_dest=(uint8*)p_file_header;
3318  for (uint32 i=0; i<sizeof(SMcFileHeader); ++i)
3319  {
3320  *p_dest++=0;
3321  }
3322 
3323  if (Config::GetHardware()==Config::HARDWARE_NGC)
3324  {
3325  if (!s_insert_ngc_icon(p_file_header,p_card,pFile,file_type,p_name))
3326  {
3327  goto ERROR;
3328  }
3329  }
3330 
3331  p_file_header->mVersion=s_get_version_number(file_type);
3332  p_file_header->mSummaryInfoSize=summary_info_size;
3333  p_file_header->mDataSize=header_and_structures_size;
3334 
3335  p_dest=(uint8*)(p_file_header+1);
3336 
3337  // Write in the summary info and calculate its checksum.
3338  BytesWritten=WriteToBuffer(pSummaryInfo, p_dest, summary_info_size, Script::NO_ASSERT);
3339  if (BytesWritten!=summary_info_size)
3340  {
3341  // Note: This assert is surrounded by an if to prevent a warning on non debug builds
3342  // due to the BytesWritten variable being unused.
3343  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("BytesWritten does not equal summary_info_size ?"));
3344  }
3345  p_file_header->mSummaryInfoChecksum=Crc::GenerateCRCCaseSensitive((const char *)p_dest,summary_info_size);
3346  p_dest+=summary_info_size;
3347 
3348 
3349  // Write in the game save info
3350  BytesWritten=WriteToBuffer(pMemCardStuff, p_dest, structure_size, Script::NO_ASSERT);
3351 
3352  // K: Last minute fix, 'encrypt' the network settings so that the AOL info cannot be
3353  // read. Not very secure, but it should be enough to make the strings non obvious.
3354  if (file_type==0xca41692d) // NetworkSettings
3355  {
3356  //printf("Encrypting %d bytes ...\n",structure_size);
3357  for (uint32 e=0; e<structure_size; ++e)
3358  {
3359  p_dest[e]+=0x69;
3360  }
3361  }
3362 
3363  if (BytesWritten!=structure_size)
3364  {
3365  // Note: This assert is surrounded by an if to prevent a warning on non debug builds
3366  // due to the BytesWritten variable being unused.
3367  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("BytesWritten does not equal structure_size ?"));
3368  }
3369  p_dest+=structure_size;
3370 
3371  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_dest==pTemp+header_and_structures_size,("What ?"));
3372 
3373  #ifdef __PLAT_XBOX__
3374  HANDLE h_signature=XCalculateSignatureBegin(0);
3375  if (XCalculateSignatureUpdate(h_signature,(const BYTE *)(pTemp),header_and_structures_size) != ERROR_SUCCESS)
3376  {
3377  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("XCalculateSignatureUpdate failed!"));
3378  }
3379  if (pad_size)
3380  {
3381  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_pad,("NULL p_pad ?"));
3382  if (XCalculateSignatureUpdate(h_signature,(const BYTE *)(p_pad),pad_size) != ERROR_SUCCESS)
3383  {
3384  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("XCalculateSignatureUpdate failed!"));
3385  }
3386  }
3387  if (XCalculateSignatureEnd(h_signature,&p_file_header->mSignature)!=ERROR_SUCCESS)
3388  {
3389  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("XCalculateSignatureEnd failed!"));
3390  }
3391  #else
3392  // Now calculate a checksum of all that data.
3393  // It will include the contents of p_file_header in the data too,
3394  // including mChecksum itself which will be zero at this point.
3395  // By zeroing mChecksum and including it in the data that is checksum'd it
3396  // means that the order of the members of SMcFileHeader does not matter.
3397  // Just seems kind of ugly having to have mChecksum be the first member, cos
3398  // it would also mean having to take the address of the second member to get
3399  // the start address of the data to checksum, bleurgh.
3400 
3401  p_file_header->mChecksum=Crc::GenerateCRCCaseSensitive((const char*)pTemp,header_and_structures_size);
3402  #endif // #ifdef __PLAT_XBOX__
3403 
3404  CardBytesWritten=pFile->Write( pTemp, header_and_structures_size );
3405  //printf("Wrote %d bytes\n",CardBytesWritten);
3406  s_insufficient_space=p_card->GetLastError()==Mc::Card::vINSUFFICIENT_SPACE;
3407  if (CardBytesWritten!=header_and_structures_size)
3408  {
3409  goto ERROR;
3410  }
3411 
3412 
3413 #if __USE_REPLAYS__
3414  // Write out the big replay buffer.
3415  // It cannot be written out in one go by getting its base pointer, because on
3416  // the GameCube it is stored in ARAM.
3417  // The only way to access it is via the ReadFromBuffer function.
3418  // Also, there is not enough memory to copy it into a big temporary buffer,
3419  // so write it out in small chunks.
3420  if (file_type==0x26c80b0d/* Replay */)
3421  {
3422  // Initialise the checksum, which is calculated cumulatively.
3423  uint32 replay_data_checksum=0xffffffff;
3424 
3425  // Write out the replay data header.
3426  CardBytesWritten=pFile->Write( (uint8*)&replay_data_header, sizeof(Replay::SReplayDataHeader) );
3427  s_insufficient_space=p_card->GetLastError()==Mc::Card::vINSUFFICIENT_SPACE;
3428  if (CardBytesWritten!=sizeof(Replay::SReplayDataHeader))
3429  {
3430  goto ERROR;
3431  }
3432 
3433  replay_data_checksum=Crc::UpdateCRC((const char *)&replay_data_header,sizeof(Replay::SReplayDataHeader),replay_data_checksum);
3434 
3435 
3436  // Write out the start-state dummies.
3437  Replay::SSavedDummy saved_dummy;
3438  Replay::CDummy *p_dummy=Replay::GetFirstStartStateDummy();
3439  int count=0;
3440  while (p_dummy)
3441  {
3442  p_dummy->Save(&saved_dummy);
3443 
3444  CardBytesWritten=pFile->Write( (uint8*)&saved_dummy, sizeof(Replay::SSavedDummy) );
3445  s_insufficient_space=p_card->GetLastError()==Mc::Card::vINSUFFICIENT_SPACE;
3446  if (CardBytesWritten!=sizeof(Replay::SSavedDummy))
3447  {
3448  goto ERROR;
3449  }
3450  replay_data_checksum=Crc::UpdateCRC((const char *)&saved_dummy,sizeof(Replay::SSavedDummy),replay_data_checksum);
3451 
3452  p_dummy=p_dummy->mpNext;
3453  ++count;
3454  }
3455  if (count!=replay_data_header.mNumStartStateDummies)
3456  {
3457  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("Dummy count mismatch"));
3458  }
3459 
3460  int buf_size=Replay::GetBufferSize();
3461  Dbg_MsgAssert((buf_size%REPLAY_BUFFER_CHUNK_SIZE)==0,("Replay buffer size not a multiple of REPLAY_BUFFER_CHUNK_SIZE"));
3462 
3463  uint8 *p_chunk=Replay::GetTempBuffer();
3464  int num_chunks=buf_size/REPLAY_BUFFER_CHUNK_SIZE;
3465 
3466  uint32 offset=0;
3467  for (int i=0; i<num_chunks; ++i)
3468  {
3469  Replay::ReadFromBuffer(p_chunk,offset,REPLAY_BUFFER_CHUNK_SIZE);
3470  replay_data_checksum=Crc::UpdateCRC((const char *)p_chunk,REPLAY_BUFFER_CHUNK_SIZE,replay_data_checksum);
3471 
3472  offset+=REPLAY_BUFFER_CHUNK_SIZE;
3473 
3474  CardBytesWritten=pFile->Write( p_chunk, REPLAY_BUFFER_CHUNK_SIZE );
3475  s_insufficient_space=p_card->GetLastError()==Mc::Card::vINSUFFICIENT_SPACE;
3476  if (CardBytesWritten!=REPLAY_BUFFER_CHUNK_SIZE)
3477  {
3478  goto ERROR;
3479  }
3480  }
3481 
3482  // Write out the replay data checksum
3483  CardBytesWritten=pFile->Write( (uint8*)&replay_data_checksum, 4 );
3484  s_insufficient_space=p_card->GetLastError()==Mc::Card::vINSUFFICIENT_SPACE;
3485  if (CardBytesWritten!=4)
3486  {
3487  goto ERROR;
3488  }
3489  }
3490 #endif
3491 
3492  // Now write out padding so as to make sure the file has size fixed_size, otherwise
3493  // there will be a discrepancy between the space that the game claims is required and
3494  // the size that appears in the file list, and I'll get a ton of TT bugs.
3495  if ( Config::GetHardware() != Config::HARDWARE_NGC)
3496  {
3497  // TODO: Fix bug in the Write function for the NGC. It always writes from offset 0,
3498  // meaning that writing this padding overwrites the start of the file data.
3499  // We don't actually have to write this padding on the NGC, because the resultant file size
3500  // will be exactly that specified in the file Open command.
3501  // But the bug will manifest itself when saving the replay data, so need to fix it ...
3502  if (pad_size)
3503  {
3504  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_pad,("NULL p_pad ?"));
3505  CardBytesWritten=pFile->Write( p_pad, pad_size );
3506  //printf("Wrote %d bytes\n",CardBytesWritten);
3507 
3508  s_insufficient_space=p_card->GetLastError()==Mc::Card::vINSUFFICIENT_SPACE;
3509  if (CardBytesWritten != pad_size)
3510  {
3511  goto ERROR;
3512  }
3513  }
3514  }
3515 
3516  SavedOK=true;
3517 
3518 ERROR:
3519  if (p_pad)
3520  {
3521  Mem::Free(p_pad);
3522  }
3523  if (pTemp)
3524  {
3525  Mem::Free(pTemp);
3526  }
3527  if (pFile)
3528  {
3529  if (!pFile->Flush())
3530  {
3531  SavedOK=false;
3532  }
3533  if (!pFile->Close())
3534  {
3535  SavedOK=false;
3536  }
3537  delete pFile;
3538  }
3539 
3540  delete pSummaryInfo;
3541  delete pMemCardStuff;
3542 
3543 
3544  if (got_special_pools)
3545  {
3546  Dbg_MsgAssert(CComponent::SGetNumUsedItems()==0,("Expected the special mem card CComponent pool to be empty at this point, but got %d items",CComponent::SGetNumUsedItems()));
3547  Dbg_MsgAssert(CStruct::SGetNumUsedItems()==0,("Expected the special mem card CStruct pool to be empty at this point, but got %d items",CStruct::SGetNumUsedItems()));
3548  Dbg_MsgAssert(CVector::SGetNumUsedItems()==0,("Expected the special mem card CVector pool to be empty at this point, but got %d items",CVector::SGetNumUsedItems()));
3549  CComponent::SSwitchToPreviousPool();
3550  CStruct::SSwitchToPreviousPool();
3551  CVector::SSwitchToPreviousPool();
3552  }
3553 
3554  if ( Config::GetHardware() != Config::HARDWARE_XBOX)
3555  {
3556  Pcm::PauseMusic( -1 );
3557  Pcm::PauseStream( -1 );
3558  }
3559 
3560  if (Config::GetHardware() == Config::HARDWARE_NGC)
3561  {
3562  ScriptRemoveTemporaryMemCardPools(NULL,NULL);
3563  }
3564 
3565  return SavedOK;
3566 }

3569 /* */
3570 /* */
3571 /******************************************************************/

3573 #if __USE_REPLAYS__
3574  #ifdef __PLAT_NGC__
3575  static SMcFileHeader sFileHeader __attribute__((aligned( 32 )));
3576  #else
3577  static SMcFileHeader sFileHeader;
3578  #endif
3579 #endif
3580 
3581 bool ScriptSetSectionsToApplyWhenLoading(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
3582 {
3583  printf("ScriptSetSectionsToApplyWhenLoading was called.........................\n");
3584  // These flags only apply when loading type OptionsAndPros.
3585  // They allow for only certain sections of the file being applied to the game state.
3586  // For example, when loading a custom skater, only the CUSTOM_SKATER part must be applied.
3587  s_apply_flags=0;
3588 
3589  if (pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0x16b506c0,"ApplyCustomSkater")))
3590  {
3591  s_apply_flags |= 1<<APPLY_CUSTOM_SKATER;
3592  }
3593  if (pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0xdc7ea3ce,"ApplyStorySkater")))
3594  {
3595  s_apply_flags |= 1<<APPLY_STORY_SKATER;
3596  }
3597  if (pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0x33ec233f,"ApplyStory")))
3598  {
3599  s_apply_flags |= 1<<APPLY_STORY;
3600  }
3601  if (pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0xb39d7cc4,"ApplyGeneralOptions")))
3602  {
3603  s_apply_flags |= 1<<APPLY_GLOBAL_INFO;
3604  }
3605 
3606  if (pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0xc4e78e22,"all")))
3607  {
3608  s_apply_flags=0xffffffff;
3609  }
3610 
3611  return true;
3612 }

3614 // @script | LoadFromMemoryCard | Load the specified file from the memory card
3615 // @parm string | Name | The name of the file to load
3616 // @parm name | Type | The type of the file (cas, network, park, etc.)
3617 bool ScriptLoadFromMemoryCard(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
3618 {
3619  Dbg_MsgAssert(!Config::Bootstrap(),("Can't use memory card from bootstrap demo"));
3620 
3621  if ( Config::GetHardware() != Config::HARDWARE_XBOX)
3622  {
3623  Pcm::PauseMusic(true);
3624  Pcm::PauseStream(true);
3625  }
3626 
3627  // Create structures for holding the summary info & game save info
3628  CStruct *pSummaryInfo=new CStruct;
3629  CStruct *pMemCardStuff=new CStruct;
3630 
3631  // A bunch of variable declarations, which need to be up here cos there are goto's later
3632  const char *p_name="";
3633  uint32 file_type=0;
3634 
3635  Mc::File* p_file=NULL;
3636  int file_size=0;
3637  uint8 *p_temp=NULL;
3638  uint8 *p_stuff=NULL;
3639  SMcFileHeader *p_file_header;
3640  bool loaded_ok=false;
3641  uint32 calculated_checksum=0;
3642  uint32 stored_checksum=0;
3643  bool checksum_matches=false;
3644 
3645  // The LoadForUpload flag is passed as an integer so that that calls to LoadFromMemoryCard
3646  // in script can set LoadForUpload equal to the value of some script global for convenience.
3647  int load_for_upload=0;
3648  pParams->GetInteger(CRCD(0x8c6808d4,"LoadForUpload"),&load_for_upload);
3649 
3650  #ifdef __PLAT_XBOX__
3651  XCALCSIG_SIGNATURE stored_signature;
3652  XCALCSIG_SIGNATURE calculated_signature;
3653  HANDLE h_signature;
3654  BYTE *p_a=NULL;
3655  BYTE *p_b=NULL;
3656  #endif
3657 
3658  // Get the card.
3659  Mc::Manager * mc_man = Mc::Manager::Instance();
3660  Mc::Card* p_card=mc_man->GetCard(0,0);
3661  if (!p_card)
3662  {
3663  goto ERROR;
3664  }
3665  // GameCube often crashes if try to do card operations on a bad card, so do this check first.
3666  if (!p_card->IsFormatted())
3667  {
3668  goto ERROR;
3669  }
3670 
3671 
3672  pParams->GetText("Name",&p_name);
3673  pParams->GetChecksum("Type",&file_type);
3674 
3675  // Calculate the low-level filename
3676  char p_card_file_name[MAX_CARD_FILE_NAME_CHARS+1];
3677  p_card_file_name[0]=0;
3678 
3679  switch (Config::GetHardware())
3680  {
3681  case Config::HARDWARE_PS2:
3682  case Config::HARDWARE_PS2_PROVIEW:
3683  case Config::HARDWARE_PS2_DEVSYSTEM:
3684  {
3685  const char *p_header=Config::GetMemCardHeader();
3686  char p_ascii_checksum[20];
3687  s_generate_ascii_checksum(p_ascii_checksum,p_name,file_type);
3688 
3689  sprintf(p_card_file_name,"/%s%s/%s%s", p_header,p_ascii_checksum,
3690  p_header,p_ascii_checksum);
3691  break;
3692  }
3693  case Config::HARDWARE_NGC:
3694  {
3695  char p_directory_name[MAX_CARD_FILE_NAME_CHARS+1];
3696  s_generate_card_directory_name(file_type,p_name,p_directory_name);
3697 
3698  sprintf(p_card_file_name,"%s%s",p_directory_name,p_directory_name);
3699  break;
3700  }
3701  case Config::HARDWARE_XBOX:
3702  {
3703  // Generate the directory name
3704  const char *p_directory_name=s_generate_xbox_directory_name(file_type,p_name);
3705  const char *p_low_level_directory_name=p_card->ConvertDirectory(p_directory_name);
3706 
3707  if (!p_low_level_directory_name)
3708  {
3709  goto ERROR;
3710  }
3711 
3712  // Calculate the low-level file name.
3713  sprintf( p_card_file_name, "/%s/%s", p_low_level_directory_name, p_low_level_directory_name );
3714  break;
3715  }
3716  default:
3717  {
3718  goto ERROR;
3719  break;
3720  }
3721  }
3722 
3723  Dbg_MsgAssert(strlen(p_card_file_name)<MAX_CARD_FILE_NAME_CHARS+1,("Oops"));
3724 
3725 #if __USE_REPLAYS__
3726  if (file_type==0x26c80b0d/* Replay */)
3727  {
3728  strcpy(spReplayCardFileName,p_card_file_name);
3729  sNeedToLoadReplayBuffer=true;
3730  }
3731 #endif
3732 
3733  // Open the file.
3734  p_file=p_card->Open( p_card_file_name, Mc::File::mMODE_READ );
3735  if (!p_file)
3736  {
3737  // File could not be opened
3738  goto ERROR;
3739  }
3740 
3741  // File opened OK
3742 
3743  // Check the file size.
3744  file_size=p_file->Seek( 0 ,Mc::File::BASE_END);
3745  // Removed the file size check, because the fixed size needed to be updated, and keeping the
3746  // check would prevent existing parks from being able to be loaded.
3747  //if (file_size != (int)sGetFixedFileSize(file_type))
3748  //{
3749  // // Size mismatch, so consider the file corrupted.
3750  // pScript->GetParams()->AddChecksum(NONAME,GenerateCRC("CorruptedData"));
3751  // goto ERROR;
3752  //}
3753 
3754  // Read the file into memory
3755  // Allocate a temporary buffer for reading the file into
3756  p_temp=(uint8*)Mem::Malloc(file_size);
3757  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_temp,("Could not allocate %d bytes for file buffer for file %s",file_size,p_card_file_name));
3758 
3759  p_file->Seek(0,Mc::File::BASE_START);
3760  if (p_file->Read(p_temp, file_size) != file_size)
3761  {
3762  // Some sort of read error.
3763  goto ERROR;
3764  }
3765 
3766  // Seemed to read into memory OK
3767  // Check if the data is corrupt by recalculating the checksum.
3768  p_stuff=p_temp;
3769  p_file_header=(SMcFileHeader*)p_stuff;
3770 
3771  #ifdef __PLAT_XBOX__
3772  // Load p_file_header->mSignature into stored_signature
3773  // then zero out p_file_header->mSignature
3774  p_a=p_file_header->mSignature.Signature;
3775  p_b=stored_signature.Signature;
3776  for (int i=0; i<XCALCSIG_SIGNATURE_SIZE; ++i)
3777  {
3778  *p_b=*p_a;
3779  *p_a=0;
3780  ++p_a;
3781  ++p_b;
3782  }
3783 
3784  // Calculate the signature of the data.
3785  h_signature=XCalculateSignatureBegin(0);
3786  if (XCalculateSignatureUpdate(h_signature,(const BYTE *)p_stuff,file_size) != ERROR_SUCCESS)
3787  {
3788  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("XCalculateSignatureUpdate failed!"));
3789  }
3790  if (XCalculateSignatureEnd(h_signature,&calculated_signature)!=ERROR_SUCCESS)
3791  {
3792  Dbg_MsgAssert(0,("XCalculateSignatureEnd failed!"));
3793  }
3794 
3795  // Compare the calculated signature with the stored one.
3796  p_a=stored_signature.Signature;
3797  p_b=calculated_signature.Signature;
3798  checksum_matches=true;
3799  for (int i=0; i<XCALCSIG_SIGNATURE_SIZE; ++i)
3800  {
3801  if (*p_a != *p_b)
3802  {
3803  checksum_matches=false;
3804  break;
3805  }
3806  ++p_a;
3807  ++p_b;
3808  }
3809 
3810  #else
3811  checksum_matches=false;
3812  stored_checksum=p_file_header->mChecksum;
3813 
3814  // Set the checksum to zero because that was what it was when
3815  // the checksum was calculated.
3816  p_file_header->mChecksum=0;
3817  // Using p_file_header->mDataSize instead of file_size, because file_size includes the
3818  // padding, which is not included in the checksum calculation on PS2 and NGC
3819  if (p_file_header->mDataSize > 500000)
3820  {
3821  // If mDataSize itself is corrupted, then don't go trying to calculate the
3822  // checksum of megabytes of data, in case that hangs the game by hitting some sort
3823  // of restricted memory location.
3824  }
3825  else
3826  {
3827  calculated_checksum=Crc::GenerateCRCCaseSensitive((const char*)p_stuff,p_file_header->mDataSize);
3828 
3829  if (calculated_checksum==stored_checksum &&
3830  p_file_header->mVersion==s_get_version_number(file_type))
3831  {
3832  checksum_matches=true;
3833  }
3834  }
3835  #endif
3836 
3837 
3838  if (checksum_matches)
3839  {
3840  // The data is OK, so it is safe to parse it.
3841 
3842  // Skip over the header.
3843  p_stuff=(uint8*)(p_file_header+1);
3844 
3845  // Skip over the summary info
3846  p_stuff=ReadFromBuffer(pSummaryInfo, p_stuff);
3847 
3848  // K: Last minute fix, 'decrypt' the network settings.
3849  if (file_type==0xca41692d) // NetworkSettings
3850  {
3851  int num_bytes=p_file_header->mDataSize-(p_stuff-((uint8*)p_file_header));
3852  //printf("Decrypting %d bytes ...\n",num_bytes);
3853  for (int e=0; e<num_bytes; ++e)
3854  {
3855  p_stuff[e]-=0x69;
3856  }
3857  }
3858 
3859  // Read in the game save info
3860  ReadFromBuffer(pMemCardStuff, p_stuff);
3861 
3862  // The data is now safely in pMemCardStuff ...
3863 
3864  if (load_for_upload)
3865  {
3866  // If the file was loaded for upload to the net, then do not process the data
3867  // but just store it away so that the GetMemCardDataForUpload command can retrieve
3868  // it a bit later.
3869  Dbg_MsgAssert(spVaultData==NULL,("\n%s\nLoadFromMemoryCard expected the vault data to be cleared at this point ?",pScript->GetScriptInfo()));
3870  spVaultData=new Script::CStruct;
3871  spVaultData->AppendStructure(pMemCardStuff);
3872  sVaultDataType=file_type;
3873 
3874  if ( file_type == CRCD(0x61a1bc57,"cat") )
3875  {
3876  // load Created trick in edit slot so we can get some info out of it for uploading
3877  s_read_game_save_info(file_type, pMemCardStuff, pScript);
3878  }
3879  }
3880  else
3881  {
3882  // process the data according to the type of file loaded.
3883  s_read_game_save_info(file_type, pMemCardStuff, pScript);
3884  }
3885 
3886  loaded_ok=true;
3887  }
3888  else
3889  {
3890  // Corrupted data, or bad version number
3891  pScript->GetParams()->AddChecksum(NONAME,GenerateCRC("CorruptedData"));
3892  }
3893 
3894  // if the loading was successful,
3895  // then run some post-load functions
3896  if ( loaded_ok )
3897  {
3898  if (load_for_upload)
3899  {
3900  // If the file was loaded for upload to the net, then do not do any post processing,
3901  // since the data has just been stored away for retrieval later.
3902  }
3903  else
3904  {
3905  Script::RunScript( "post_load_from_memory_card", pParams );
3906  }
3907  }
3908 
3909 ERROR:
3910  // Cleanup and unpause the music.
3911  if (p_file)
3912  {
3913  p_file->Close();
3914  delete p_file;
3915  }
3916 
3917  if (p_temp)
3918  {
3919  Mem::Free(p_temp);
3920  }
3921 
3922  delete pSummaryInfo;
3923  delete pMemCardStuff;
3924  if ( Config::GetHardware() != Config::HARDWARE_XBOX)
3925  {
3926  Pcm::PauseMusic( -1 );
3927  Pcm::PauseStream( -1 );
3928  }
3929 
3930  return loaded_ok;
3931 }

3934 {
3935  return s_did_apply_custom_skater_info;
3936 }

3968 bool ScriptLoadReplayData(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
3969 {
3970 #if __USE_REPLAYS__
3971  Dbg_MsgAssert(!Config::Bootstrap(),("Can't use memory card from bootstrap demo"));
3972 
3973  Pcm::PauseMusic(true);
3974  Pcm::PauseStream(true);
3975 
3976  Dbg_MsgAssert(sNeedToLoadReplayBuffer,("Called LoadReplayBuffer when sNeedToLoadReplayBuffer is false"));
3977 
3978  int replay_buffer_size=0;
3979  Replay::SReplayDataHeader header;
3980  Replay::SSavedDummy saved_dummy;
3981  uint32 replay_data_checksum=0xffffffff; // Initialise the checksum, which is calculated accumulatively.
3982  uint32 ch=0;
3983  bool loaded_ok=false;
3984  int bytes_read=0;
3985  Mc::File* p_file=NULL;
3986  uint8 *p_chunk=NULL;
3987  int num_chunks=0;
3988  int offset=0;
3989 
3990  // Get the card.
3991  Mc::Manager * mc_man = Mc::Manager::Instance();
3992  Mc::Card* p_card=mc_man->GetCard(0,0);
3993  if (!p_card)
3994  {
3995  goto ERROR;
3996  }
3997 
3998  // GameCube often crashes if try to do card operations on a bad card, so do this check first.
3999  if (!p_card->IsFormatted())
4000  {
4001  goto ERROR;
4002  }
4003 
4004  // Open the file.
4005  p_file=p_card->Open( spReplayCardFileName, Mc::File::mMODE_READ );
4006  if (!p_file)
4007  {
4008  // File could not be opened
4009  goto ERROR;
4010  }
4011 
4012  // File opened OK
4013 
4014  // Seek to the start of the replay data by reading in the header, reading out the start data
4015  // size from the header, then seeking there.
4016  p_file->Seek( 0 ,Mc::File::BASE_START);
4017  if (p_file->Read((uint8*)&sFileHeader, sizeof(SMcFileHeader)) != sizeof(SMcFileHeader))
4018  {
4019  // Some sort of read error.
4020  goto ERROR;
4021  }
4022  p_file->Seek(sFileHeader.mDataSize,Mc::File::BASE_START);
4023 
4024  // Make sure the buffer does exist
4025  Replay::AllocateBuffer();
4026  // and that it is cleared to start with.
4027  Replay::ClearBuffer();
4028 
4029  // Read in the header
4030  bytes_read=p_file->Read( (uint8*)&header, sizeof(Replay::SReplayDataHeader) );
4031  if (bytes_read!=sizeof(Replay::SReplayDataHeader))
4032  {
4033  // Some sort of read error.
4034  goto ERROR;
4035  }
4036  Replay::ReadReplayDataHeader(&header);
4037  replay_data_checksum=Crc::UpdateCRC((const char *)&header,sizeof(Replay::SReplayDataHeader),replay_data_checksum);
4038 
4039  // Read in the dummies
4040  for (int i=0; i<header.mNumStartStateDummies; ++i)
4041  {
4042  bytes_read=p_file->Read( (uint8*)&saved_dummy, sizeof(Replay::SSavedDummy) );
4043  if (bytes_read!=sizeof(Replay::SSavedDummy))
4044  {
4045  // Some sort of read error.
4046  goto ERROR;
4047  }
4048  replay_data_checksum=Crc::UpdateCRC((const char *)&saved_dummy,sizeof(Replay::SSavedDummy),replay_data_checksum);
4049 
4050  Replay::CreateDummyFromSaveData(&saved_dummy);
4051  }
4052 
4053  // Read the data in a chunk at a time.
4054  replay_buffer_size=Replay::GetBufferSize();
4055  Dbg_MsgAssert((replay_buffer_size%REPLAY_BUFFER_CHUNK_SIZE)==0,("Replay buffer size not a multiple of REPLAY_BUFFER_CHUNK_SIZE"));
4056 
4057  p_chunk=Replay::GetTempBuffer();
4058  num_chunks=replay_buffer_size/REPLAY_BUFFER_CHUNK_SIZE;
4059 
4060  offset=0;
4061  for (int i=0; i<num_chunks; ++i)
4062  {
4063  bytes_read=p_file->Read( p_chunk, REPLAY_BUFFER_CHUNK_SIZE );
4064  if (bytes_read!=REPLAY_BUFFER_CHUNK_SIZE)
4065  {
4066  // Some sort of read error.
4067  goto ERROR;
4068  }
4069  Replay::WriteIntoBuffer(p_chunk,offset,REPLAY_BUFFER_CHUNK_SIZE);
4070  replay_data_checksum=Crc::UpdateCRC((const char *)p_chunk,REPLAY_BUFFER_CHUNK_SIZE,replay_data_checksum);
4071 
4072  offset+=REPLAY_BUFFER_CHUNK_SIZE;
4073  }
4074 
4075  // Read in and check the checksum
4076  bytes_read=p_file->Read( (uint8*)&ch, 4 );
4077  if (bytes_read!=4)
4078  {
4079  // Some sort of read error.
4080  goto ERROR;
4081  }
4082  if (ch != replay_data_checksum)
4083  {
4084  goto ERROR;
4085  }
4086 
4087  // Hooray!
4088  loaded_ok=true;
4089 
4090 ERROR:
4091  sNeedToLoadReplayBuffer=false;
4092 
4093  if (p_file)
4094  {
4095  p_file->Close();
4096  delete p_file;
4097  }
4098 
4099  Pcm::PauseMusic( -1 );
4100  Pcm::PauseStream( -1 );
4101  return loaded_ok;
4102 #else
4103  return false;
4104 #endif
4105 }

4121 /******************************************************************/
4122 
4123 static uint8 spSummaryInfoBuffer[sizeof(SMcFileHeader)+MAX_SUMMARY_INFO_SIZE];
4124 bool ScriptGetMemCardDirectoryListing(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
4125 {
4126  pScript->GetParams()->RemoveComponent("DirectoryListing");
4127  pScript->GetParams()->RemoveComponent("FilesLimitReached");
4128  pScript->GetParams()->RemoveComponent("TotalTHPS4FilesOnCard");
4129 
4130  uint32 file_type_to_list=0;
4131  pParams->GetChecksum("FileType",&file_type_to_list);
4132 
4133  // Get a directory listing of the whole card.
4134  Mc::Manager * p_mc_man = Mc::Manager::Instance();
4135  Mc::Card* p_card=p_mc_man->GetCard(0,0);
4136  if (!p_card)
4137  {
4138  return true;
4139  }
4140 
4141  Lst::Head< Mc::File > file_list;
4142  p_card->GetFileList( "*", file_list );
4143 
4144  // If the special pools exist, switch to them so that the components & structs etc get allocated off them.
4145  // The special pools use the space freed by unloading the skater anims, and are for preventing memory
4146  // overflows when the save size gets large.
4147  Dbg_MsgAssert(CComponent::SGetCurrentPoolIndex()==0,("Bad current CComponent pool"));
4148  Dbg_MsgAssert(CStruct::SGetCurrentPoolIndex()==0,("Bad current CStruct pool"));
4149  bool got_special_pools=false;
4150 
4151  CComponent::SSwitchToNextPool();
4152  if (CComponent::SPoolExists())
4153  {
4154  CStruct::SSwitchToNextPool();
4155  Dbg_MsgAssert(CStruct::SPoolExists(),("No special CStruct pool ?"));
4156  got_special_pools=true;
4157  }
4158  else
4159  {
4160  CComponent::SSwitchToPreviousPool();
4161  }
4162 
4163 
4164  int num_files_added=0;
4165  CStruct *pp_structs[MAX_THPS4_FILES_ALLOWED];
4166 
4167  // Run through all the files (well, directory names actually) and compare their
4168  // first 12 characters with the THPS4 header.
4169  const char *p_header=Config::GetMemCardHeader();
4170  int header_len=strlen(p_header);
4171 
4172  int num_files=file_list.CountItems();
4173  int total_thps4_files=0;
4174  for (int i=0; i<num_files; ++i)
4175  {
4176  Mc::File *p_file=file_list.GetItem(i)->GetData();
4177 
4178  bool is_THPS4_file=true;
4179 
4180  // No need to check the file name if it's the XBox because all the files
4181  // will be in our filespace.
4182  if ( Config::GetHardware() != Config::HARDWARE_XBOX )
4183  {
4184  for (int j=0; j<header_len; ++j)
4185  {
4186  if (p_file->m_Filename[j]!=p_header[j])
4187  {
4188  is_THPS4_file=false;
4189  break;
4190  }
4191  }
4192  }
4193 
4194  if (!is_THPS4_file)
4195  {
4196  continue;
4197  }
4198 
4199  ++total_thps4_files;
4200 
4201  // It is a THPS4 file, so compare the file type with that requested.
4202  uint32 file_type=0;
4203 
4204 
4205  switch (Config::GetHardware())
4206  {
4207  case Config::HARDWARE_PS2:
4208  case Config::HARDWARE_PS2_PROVIEW:
4209  case Config::HARDWARE_PS2_DEVSYSTEM:
4210  case Config::HARDWARE_NGC:
4211  // The filetype is indicated by the last letter of the 8 characters
4212  // that follow the header. The other 7 contain the ascii checksum of
4213  // the full file name as entered by the user.
4214  file_type=s_determine_file_type(p_file->m_Filename[header_len+8-1]);
4215  break;
4216  case Config::HARDWARE_XBOX:
4217  {
4218  // TODO: Remove this ifdef somehow, needed currently because m_DisplayFilename
4219  // is only defined for XBox. Shouldn't really have any platform ifdefs in this file.
4220  #ifdef __PLAT_XBOX__
4221  int length = strlen( p_file->m_DisplayFilename );
4222  if( stricmp( &p_file->m_DisplayFilename[length - 15], "NetworkSettings" ) == 0 )
4223  {
4224  file_type = 0xca41692d; // NetworkSettings
4225  }
4226  else if( stricmp( &p_file->m_DisplayFilename[length - 6], "Skater" ) == 0 )
4227  {
4228  file_type = 0xb010f357; // OptionsAndPros
4229  }
4230  else if( stricmp( &p_file->m_DisplayFilename[length - 4], "Park" ) == 0 )
4231  {
4232  file_type = 0x3bf882cc; // Park
4233  }
4234  else if( stricmp( &p_file->m_DisplayFilename[length - 6], "Skater" ) == 0 )
4235  {
4236  file_type = 0xffc529f4; // Cas
4237  }
4238  else if( stricmp( &p_file->m_DisplayFilename[length - 5], "Trick" ) == 0 )
4239  {
4240  file_type = 0x61a1bc57; // CAT
4241  }
4242  else if( stricmp( &p_file->m_DisplayFilename[length - 6], "Replay" ) == 0 )
4243  {
4244  file_type = 0x26c80b0d; // Replay
4245  }
4246  else if( stricmp( &p_file->m_DisplayFilename[length - 5], "Goals" ) == 0 )
4247  {
4248  file_type = 0x62896edf; // CreatedGoals
4249  }
4250  #endif // #ifdef __PLAT_XBOX__
4251  break;
4252  }
4253  case Config::HARDWARE_WIN32:
4254  break;
4255  default:
4256  break;
4257  }
4258 
4259 
4260 
4261  if ( (file_type_to_list==0 && file_type!=0) ||
4262  file_type==file_type_to_list)
4263  {
4264  if (num_files_added < MAX_THPS4_FILES_ALLOWED)
4265  {
4266  // It's safe to add a new entry to the array.
4267  CStruct *p_struct=new CStruct;
4268  p_struct->AddChecksum("file_type",file_type);
4269  p_struct->AddInteger("Index",num_files_added);
4270 
4271 
4272  p_struct->AddInteger("Year",p_file->m_Modified.m_Year);
4273  p_struct->AddInteger("Month",p_file->m_Modified.m_Month);
4274  p_struct->AddInteger("Day",p_file->m_Modified.m_Day);
4275  p_struct->AddInteger("Hour",p_file->m_Modified.m_Hour);
4276  p_struct->AddInteger("Minutes",p_file->m_Modified.m_Minutes);
4277  p_struct->AddInteger("Seconds",p_file->m_Modified.m_Seconds);
4278 
4279 
4280  char p_card_file_name[100];
4281  if (Config::GetHardware()==Config::HARDWARE_NGC)
4282  {
4283  sprintf(p_card_file_name,"%s",p_file->m_Filename);
4284  }
4285  else
4286  {
4287  sprintf(p_card_file_name,"/%s/%s",p_file->m_Filename,p_file->m_Filename);
4288  }
4289  Dbg_MsgAssert(strlen(p_card_file_name)<100,("Oops"));
4290 
4291  // Store the low level file name in the structure too so that the scripts
4292  // can pass it on to the file delete function. This is necessary because
4293  // even though the low level file name can be derived from the file name as
4294  // stored in the file itself, if the file is corrupted the name might be too,
4295  // so in that case it would not be possible to delete it.
4296  p_struct->AddString("actual_file_name",p_card_file_name);
4297 
4298  #ifdef __PLAT_XBOX__
4299  p_struct->AddString("xbox_directory_name",p_file->m_DisplayFilename);
4300  #endif
4301 
4302  // Need to open the file to get the summary info out of it ...
4303  Mc::File* p_mc_file=p_card->Open( p_card_file_name, Mc::File::mMODE_READ );
4304  if (p_mc_file)
4305  {
4306  // File opened OK, so grab the first hundred or so bytes.
4307  p_mc_file->Seek( 0 ,Mc::File::BASE_START);
4308  p_mc_file->Read( spSummaryInfoBuffer, sizeof(SMcFileHeader)+MAX_SUMMARY_INFO_SIZE );
4309 
4310  SMcFileHeader *p_file_header=(SMcFileHeader*)spSummaryInfoBuffer;
4311  uint8 *p_summary_info=(uint8*)(p_file_header+1);
4312 
4313  // Determine whether the summary info is corrupted.
4314  bool corrupt_summary_info=false;
4315  if (p_file_header->mSummaryInfoSize > MAX_SUMMARY_INFO_SIZE)
4316  {
4317  // The mSummaryInfoSize itself is corrupted!
4318  corrupt_summary_info=true;
4319  }
4320  else
4321  {
4322  uint32 calculated_summary_info_checksum=Crc::GenerateCRCCaseSensitive((const char *)p_summary_info,p_file_header->mSummaryInfoSize);
4323  if (calculated_summary_info_checksum != p_file_header->mSummaryInfoChecksum)
4324  {
4325  corrupt_summary_info=true;
4326  }
4327  }
4328 
4329  // Calculate the total file size
4330  int file_size=p_mc_file->Seek(0,Mc::File::BASE_END);
4331  //printf("Directory listing: %s, size=%d\n",p_card_file_name,file_size);
4332  int total_size_on_card=s_calculate_total_space_used_on_card(file_type,file_size);
4333  p_struct->AddInteger("total_file_size",total_size_on_card);
4334 
4335 
4336  // Removed the file size check, because the fixed size needed to be updated, and keeping the
4337  // check would prevent existing parks from being able to be loaded.
4338  //if (corrupt_summary_info || file_size != (int)sGetFixedFileSize(file_type))
4339  if (corrupt_summary_info)
4340  {
4341  p_struct->AddChecksum(NONAME,Script::GenerateCRC("Corrupt"));
4342  if (Config::GetHardware()==Config::HARDWARE_NGC)
4343  {
4344  p_struct->AddString("filename",GetString("NGCDamagedFile"));
4345  }
4346  else
4347  {
4348  p_struct->AddString("filename",GetString("DamagedFile"));
4349  }
4350  }
4351  else if (p_file_header->mVersion!=s_get_version_number(file_type))
4352  {
4353  #ifdef __NOPT_ASSERT__
4354  p_struct->AddChecksum(NONAME,Script::GenerateCRC("BadVersion"));
4355  p_struct->AddString("filename",GetString("BadVersionNumber"));
4356  #else
4357  p_struct->AddChecksum(NONAME,Script::GenerateCRC("Corrupt"));
4358  if (Config::GetHardware()==Config::HARDWARE_NGC)
4359  {
4360  p_struct->AddString("filename",GetString("NGCDamagedFile"));
4361  }
4362  else
4363  {
4364  p_struct->AddString("filename",GetString("DamagedFile"));
4365  }
4366  #endif
4367  }
4368  else
4369  {
4370  // Extract the summary info and stick it in the structure.
4371  // This summary info gets printed at the bottom of the files menu when
4372  // the highlight is on the file.
4373  // The summary info is actually in the main structure stored in the file,
4374  // but that would require loading in the whole thing which would take a
4375  // long time.
4376 
4377  // Have to use a temporary structure because ReadFromBuffer clears the
4378  // passed structure first.
4379  CStruct *p_temp=new CStruct;
4380  ReadFromBuffer(p_temp,p_summary_info);
4381  p_struct->AppendStructure(p_temp);
4382  delete p_temp;
4383  }
4384 
4385  p_mc_file->Close();
4386  delete p_mc_file;
4387  }
4388  else
4389  {
4390  // If the file did not open at all, treat it as corrupted.
4391  p_struct->AddChecksum(NONAME,Script::GenerateCRC("Corrupt"));
4392  p_struct->AddString("filename",GetString("DamagedFile"));
4393  }
4394 
4395  pp_structs[num_files_added++]=p_struct;
4396  }
4397  }
4398  }
4399 
4400  if (got_special_pools)
4401  {
4402  // Note: The pools will contain stuff at this point. The script will delete them
4403  // when it does its cleanup.
4404  CComponent::SSwitchToPreviousPool();
4405  CStruct::SSwitchToPreviousPool();
4406  }
4407 
4408  // The file_list will probably get cleaned up when it goes out of scope, but just to be sure ...
4409  file_list.DestroyAllNodes();
4410 
4411  pScript->GetParams()->AddInteger("TotalTHPS4FilesOnCard",total_thps4_files);
4412 
4413  // Set the FilesLimitReached flag so that the script can determine whether to add
4414  // the 'Create New' entry to the files menu.
4415  if (total_thps4_files >= MAX_THPS4_FILES_ALLOWED)
4416  {
4417  pScript->GetParams()->AddChecksum(NONAME,0x4eec27b5/*FilesLimitReached*/);
4418  }
4419 
4420  // If files were found, add the array to the script's params.
4421  if (num_files_added)
4422  {
4423  // First, sort the array so that the files are definitely in date order (TT6112)
4424  while (true)
4425  {
4426  bool did_a_swap=false;
4427 
4428  for (int i=0; i<num_files_added-1; ++i)
4429  {
4430  if (s_first_date_is_more_recent(pp_structs[i+1],pp_structs[i]))
4431  {
4432  CStruct *p_temp=pp_structs[i];
4433  pp_structs[i]=pp_structs[i+1];
4434  pp_structs[i+1]=p_temp;
4435  did_a_swap=true;
4436  }
4437  }
4438 
4439  if (!did_a_swap)
4440  {
4441  break;
4442  }
4443  }
4444 
4445 
4446  CArray *p_directory_listing_array=new CArray;
4447  p_directory_listing_array->SetSizeAndType(num_files_added,ESYMBOLTYPE_STRUCTURE);
4448 
4449  for (int f=0; f<num_files_added; ++f)
4450  {
4451  p_directory_listing_array->SetStructure(f,pp_structs[f]);
4452  }
4453 
4454  pScript->GetParams()->AddArrayPointer("DirectoryListing",p_directory_listing_array);
4455 
4456  // Note: Not deleting the pp_structs[], cos they've been given to the array.
4457  // Not deleting p_directory_listing_array, because it's been given to the scripts params.
4458  }
4459 
4460  return true;
4461 }

4463 // Returns true if the sector size is 8K, false otherwise.
4464 // Needed as part of the GameCube card check procedure to check that the card is not some weird type.
4465 // If it's a PS2 build, it will just return true.
4466 bool ScriptSectorSizeOK(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
4467 {
4468  #ifdef __PLAT_NGC__
4469  Spt::SingletonPtr< Mc::Manager > mc_man;
4470  Mc::Card* pCard=mc_man->GetCard(0,0);
4471  if (pCard)
4472  {
4473  if (pCard->m_sector_size==8192)
4474  {
4475  return true;
4476  }
4477  else
4478  {
4479  return false;
4480  }
4481  }
4482  return false;
4483  #else
4484  return true;
4485  #endif
4486 }

4547 // For debugging, so that we can use the script debugger to view the contents of the save structure that would
4548 // get saved out to the mem card.
4549 bool ScriptGetSaveInfo(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
4550 {
4551  uint32 file_type=0;
4552  pParams->GetChecksum(CRCD(0x7321a8d6,"type"),&file_type);
4553 
4554  Script::CStruct *p_main_structure=new Script::CStruct;
4555  s_insert_game_save_info(file_type, p_main_structure);
4556  uint32 structure_size=CalculateBufferSize(p_main_structure);
4557 
4558  Script::CStruct *p_summary_info=new Script::CStruct;
4559  s_generate_summary_info(p_summary_info, file_type, p_main_structure);
4560  uint32 summary_info_size=CalculateBufferSize(p_summary_info);
4561 
4562 
4563  pScript->GetParams()->AddInteger(CRCD(0x172c1344,"MainStructureSize"),structure_size);
4564  pScript->GetParams()->AddInteger(CRCD(0x96635475,"SummaryInfoSize"),summary_info_size);
4565  pScript->GetParams()->AddInteger(CRCD(0x6afd2f7f,"MaxSummaryInfoSize"),MAX_SUMMARY_INFO_SIZE);
4566  pScript->GetParams()->AddInteger(CRCD(0xecbb8262,"TotalSize"),sizeof(SMcFileHeader)+summary_info_size+structure_size);
4567  pScript->GetParams()->AddInteger(CRCD(0xb35eb1d1,"MaxTotalSize"),sGetFixedFileSize(file_type));
4568 
4569  pScript->GetParams()->AddStructurePointer(CRCD(0x703e60ca,"SummaryInfo"),p_summary_info);
4570  pScript->GetParams()->AddStructurePointer(CRCD(0x671c9c00,"MainStructure"),p_main_structure);
4571 
4572  return true;
4573 }

4575 // It is safe to call this multiple times.
4576 bool ScriptCreateTemporaryMemCardPools(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
4577 {
4578  // If the pools exist already, do nothing.
4579  CComponent::SSwitchToNextPool();
4580  if (CComponent::SPoolExists())
4581  {
4582  CComponent::SSwitchToPreviousPool();
4583 
4584  CStruct::SSwitchToNextPool();
4585  Dbg_MsgAssert(CStruct::SPoolExists(),("Expected CStruct pool to exist"));
4586  CStruct::SSwitchToPreviousPool();
4587 
4588  CVector::SSwitchToNextPool();
4589  Dbg_MsgAssert(CVector::SPoolExists(),("Expected CVector pool to exist"));
4590  CVector::SSwitchToPreviousPool();
4591 
4592  return true;
4593  }
4594  CComponent::SSwitchToPreviousPool();
4595 
4596 #ifdef __PLAT_NGC__
4597 #define NUM_COM 16000
4598 #define NUM_STR 8000
4599 #define NUM_VEC 3000
4600 
4601 #define BUFFER_SIZE ( ( NUM_COM * 16 ) + ( NUM_STR * 8 ) + ( NUM_VEC * 16 ) )
4602 
4603  // Time for a hack...
4604  g_mc_hack = true;
4605 
4606  g_hack_address = NsARAM::alloc( BUFFER_SIZE );
4607  if ( g_hack_address )
4608  {
4609  NsDMA::toARAM( g_hack_address, g_p_buffer, BUFFER_SIZE );
4610  }
4611 
4612  memset( g_p_buffer, 0, BUFFER_SIZE );
4613 
4614  NsBuffer::reset( false );
4615 #else
4616 #define NUM_COM 50000
4617 #define NUM_STR 50000
4618 #define NUM_VEC 10000
4619 #endif // __PLAT_NGC__
4620 
4621 
4622  Mem::Manager::sHandle().PushContext(Mem::Manager::sHandle().TopDownHeap());
4623 
4624  Mem::PushMemProfile("Mem card CComponent");
4625  Dbg_MsgAssert(CComponent::SGetCurrentPoolIndex()==0,("Bad current CComponent pool"));
4626  CComponent::SSwitchToNextPool();
4627  CComponent::SCreatePool(NUM_COM, "Reserve CComponent");
4628  CComponent::SSwitchToPreviousPool();
4629  Mem::PopMemProfile();
4630 
4631  Mem::PushMemProfile("Mem card CStruct");
4632  Dbg_MsgAssert(CStruct::SGetCurrentPoolIndex()==0,("Bad current CStruct pool"));
4633  CStruct::SSwitchToNextPool();
4634  CStruct::SCreatePool(NUM_STR, "Reserve CStruct");
4635  CStruct::SSwitchToPreviousPool();
4636  Mem::PopMemProfile();
4637 
4638  // 12 bytes each (Actually 16)
4639  Mem::PushMemProfile("Mem card CVector");
4640  Dbg_MsgAssert(CVector::SGetCurrentPoolIndex()==0,("Bad current CVector pool"));
4641  CVector::SSwitchToNextPool();
4642  CVector::SCreatePool(NUM_VEC, "Reserve CVector");
4643  CVector::SSwitchToPreviousPool();
4644  Mem::PopMemProfile();
4645 
4646  Mem::Manager::sHandle().PopContext();
4647 
4648  return true;
4649 }

4651 // It is safe to call this multiple times.
4652 bool ScriptRemoveTemporaryMemCardPools(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
4653 {
4654  Dbg_MsgAssert(CComponent::SGetCurrentPoolIndex()==0,("Bad current CComponent pool"));
4655  CComponent::SSwitchToNextPool();
4656  CComponent::SRemovePool(); // Does nothing if the pool does not exist.
4657  CComponent::SSwitchToPreviousPool();
4658 
4659  Dbg_MsgAssert(CStruct::SGetCurrentPoolIndex()==0,("Bad current CStruct pool"));
4660  CStruct::SSwitchToNextPool();
4661  CStruct::SRemovePool();
4662  CStruct::SSwitchToPreviousPool();
4663 
4664  Dbg_MsgAssert(CVector::SGetCurrentPoolIndex()==0,("Bad current CVector pool"));
4665  CVector::SSwitchToNextPool();
4666  CVector::SRemovePool();
4667  CVector::SSwitchToPreviousPool();
4668 
4669 #ifdef __PLAT_NGC__
4670  if ( g_hack_address )
4671  {
4672  NsDMA::toMRAM( g_p_buffer, g_hack_address, BUFFER_SIZE );
4673  }
4674  NsARAM::free( g_hack_address );
4675 
4676  g_mc_hack = false;
4677  NsBuffer::reset( true );
4678 #endif // __PLAT_NGC__
4679 
4680  return true;
4681 }

4683 bool ScriptSwitchToTempPoolsIfTheyExist(Script::CStruct *pParams, Script::CScript *pScript)
4684 {
4685  Dbg_MsgAssert(CComponent::SGetCurrentPoolIndex()==0 && CStruct::SGetCurrentPoolIndex()==0 && CVector::SGetCurrentPoolIndex()==0, ("Expected current pools to be 0"));
4686  CComponent::SSwitchToNextPool();
4687  CStruct::SSwitchToNextPool();
4688  CVector::SSwitchToNextPool();
4689  if (CComponent::SPoolExists() && CStruct::SPoolExists() && CVector::SPoolExists())
4690  {
4691  return true;
4692  }
4693  CComponent::SSwitchToPreviousPool();
4694  CStruct::SSwitchToPreviousPool();
4695  CVector::SSwitchToPreviousPool();
4696 
4697  return false;
4698 }

4703  CStruct::SGetCurrentPoolIndex()==0 &&
4704  CVector::SGetCurrentPoolIndex()==0)
4705  {

4707  }

4710  CStruct::SSwitchToPreviousPool();

4715 // Saves any old data file to mem card
4716 bool SaveDataFile(const char *p_name, uint8 *p_data, uint32 size)
4717 {
4718  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_name,("NULL p_name"));
4719  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_data,("NULL p_data"));
4720 
4721  switch (Config::GetHardware())
4722  {
4723  case Config::HARDWARE_PS2:
4724  case Config::HARDWARE_PS2_PROVIEW:
4725  case Config::HARDWARE_PS2_DEVSYSTEM:
4726  break;
4727  default:
4728  return false;
4729  break;
4730  }
4731 
4732  if ( Config::GetHardware() != Config::HARDWARE_XBOX)
4733  {
4734  Pcm::PauseMusic(true);
4735  Pcm::PauseStream(true);
4736  }
4737 
4738  Mc::File* pFile=NULL;
4739  char p_card_file_name[MAX_CARD_FILE_NAME_CHARS+1];
4740  const char *p_header=Config::GetMemCardHeader();
4741  char p_ascii_checksum[20];
4742  int suffix=0;
4743  #define FULL_NAME_BUF_SIZE 100
4744  char p_full_name[FULL_NAME_BUF_SIZE];
4745  bool SavedOK=false;
4746  uint32 CardBytesWritten=0;
4747 
4748 
4749  Mc::Manager * mc_man = Mc::Manager::Instance();
4750  Mc::Card* p_card=mc_man->GetCard(0,0);
4751  if (!p_card)
4752  {
4753  goto ERROR;
4754  }
4755 
4756  while (true)
4757  {
4758  Dbg_MsgAssert(strlen(p_name)<FULL_NAME_BUF_SIZE-3,("p_name too long"));
4759  sprintf(p_full_name,"%s%03d",p_name,suffix);
4760  s_generate_ascii_checksum(p_ascii_checksum,p_full_name,0xb010f357/*OptionsAndPros*/);
4761  sprintf(p_card_file_name,"/%s%s/%s%s", p_header,p_ascii_checksum,
4762  p_header,p_ascii_checksum);
4763  Dbg_MsgAssert(strlen(p_card_file_name)<MAX_CARD_FILE_NAME_CHARS,("Oops"));
4764 
4765  pFile = p_card->Open( p_card_file_name, Mc::File::mMODE_READ );
4766  if (pFile)
4767  {
4768  pFile->Flush();
4769  pFile->Close();
4770  delete pFile;
4771  pFile=NULL;
4772  }
4773  else
4774  {
4775  break;
4776  }
4777  ++suffix;
4778  Dbg_MsgAssert(suffix<1000,("Too many files!!"));
4779  }
4780 
4781  printf ("Creating mem card file '%s'\n",p_full_name);
4782 
4783  if (!s_make_ps2_dir_and_icons(p_card,
4784  0xb010f357, // OptionsAndPros tee hee
4785  p_full_name,
4786  p_card_file_name,
4787  &s_insufficient_space))
4788  {
4789  goto ERROR;
4790  }
4791 
4792  // Open a file big enough to hold all data
4793  pFile=p_card->Open( p_card_file_name, Mc::File::mMODE_WRITE | Mc::File::mMODE_CREATE, s_round_up_to_platforms_block_size(size) );
4794  s_insufficient_space=p_card->GetLastError()==Mc::Card::vINSUFFICIENT_SPACE;
4795 
4796  if (!pFile)
4797  {
4798  goto ERROR;
4799  }
4800 
4801  CardBytesWritten=pFile->Write( p_data, size );
4802  s_insufficient_space=p_card->GetLastError()==Mc::Card::vINSUFFICIENT_SPACE;
4803  if (CardBytesWritten!=size)
4804  {
4805  goto ERROR;
4806  }
4807 
4808  SavedOK=true;
4809 
4810 ERROR:
4811  if (pFile)
4812  {
4813  if (!pFile->Flush())
4814  {
4815  SavedOK=false;
4816  }
4817  if (!pFile->Close())
4818  {
4819  SavedOK=false;
4820  }
4821  delete pFile;
4822  }
4823 
4824  if ( Config::GetHardware() != Config::HARDWARE_XBOX)
4825  {
4826  Pcm::PauseMusic( -1 );
4827  Pcm::PauseStream( -1 );
4828  }
4829 
4830  return SavedOK;
4831 }
4832

4835 // Load len bytes of any old data file to mem card to p_data
4836 bool LoadDataFile(const char *p_name, uint8 *p_data, uint32 size)
4837 {
4838  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_name,("NULL p_name"));
4839  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_data,("NULL p_data"));
4840 
4841  switch (Config::GetHardware())
4842  {
4843  case Config::HARDWARE_PS2:
4844  case Config::HARDWARE_PS2_PROVIEW:
4845  case Config::HARDWARE_PS2_DEVSYSTEM:
4846  break;
4847  default:
4848  return false;
4849  break;
4850  }
4851 
4852  if ( Config::GetHardware() != Config::HARDWARE_XBOX)
4853  {
4854  Pcm::PauseMusic(true);
4855  Pcm::PauseStream(true);
4856  }
4857 
4858  Mc::File* pFile=NULL;
4859  char p_card_file_name[MAX_CARD_FILE_NAME_CHARS+1];
4860  const char *p_header=Config::GetMemCardHeader();
4861  char p_ascii_checksum[20];
4862  #define FULL_NAME_BUF_SIZE 100
4863  char p_full_name[FULL_NAME_BUF_SIZE];
4864 
4865  Mc::Manager * mc_man = Mc::Manager::Instance();
4866  Mc::Card* p_card=mc_man->GetCard(0,0);
4867  if (!p_card)
4868  {
4869  return false;;
4870  }
4871 
4872  Dbg_MsgAssert(strlen(p_name)<FULL_NAME_BUF_SIZE-3,("p_name too long"));
4873  sprintf(p_full_name,"%s",p_name);
4874  s_generate_ascii_checksum(p_ascii_checksum,p_full_name,0xb010f357/*OptionsAndPros*/);
4875  sprintf(p_card_file_name,"/%s%s/%s%s", p_header,p_ascii_checksum,
4876  p_header,p_ascii_checksum);
4877  Dbg_MsgAssert(strlen(p_card_file_name)<MAX_CARD_FILE_NAME_CHARS,("Oops"));
4878 
4879  pFile = p_card->Open( p_card_file_name, Mc::File::mMODE_READ );
4880  if (pFile)
4881  {
4882  printf ("Loading From Memory Card\n");
4883  pFile->Flush();
4884  pFile->Seek( 0 ,Mc::File::BASE_START);
4885  pFile->Read(p_data,size);
4886  pFile->Flush();
4887  pFile->Close();
4888  delete pFile;
4889  return true;
4890  }
4891  return false;
4892 }
